It sounds harsh, but Gunner can learn how to use his jaw like a normal dog and live a normal life.  In Dallas, where we live and work, radiation oncology treatments are expensive.Gunner needs up to twenty sessions of radiologic therapy.Gunner needs a special diet, as he can no longer eat hard food for the time being.Gunner needs so much, including medications, therapy, and all of the other items you do not know you need when your dog is diagnosed with cancer.Kim’s first thought when she found out her sweet boy had cancer was how to care for Gunner.For her, Gunner is her focus.For those of us who have traveled the cancer road with our faithful companions, we know that there is enough anguish and worry involved. Finances make it more worrisome and frustrating.Please help, however you can, as Gunner needs you.Costs of CareRight now, the following costs are associated with Gunner's Care:CT Scan: $1,570.00-This includes the following: diagnostic scan, catheter, anesthesia, pulse ox monitor, supplies for the scan, review of the scan, and any needed fluidsSurgery: $3,500.00- Gunner is a candidate for surgery! So, he will be having surgery soon! Radiology Sessions: $6,300.00- This includes the following: EEG monitor, catheter, anesthesia, nursing fees, day care fees, NSAIDs, machine timeOffice visits: $150.00 per visit- This is simply to walk in the door and see the specialists. If Gunner visits the doctor ten times (which is a conservative estimate), that is $1,500.00This does not include daily medication, food, follow up appointments, blood work, pill pockets, and all of the other items needed to battle cancer. Therefore, I put a conservative estimate of $15,000.

name: Help 5 year old Jordyn Fight Cancer
text: Friends, Family and well-wishers, On Dec 1st, our family received the most devastating news imaginable. My beautiful niece Jordyn, age five (5), was diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumor and given a short-term life expectancy.Doctors have explained that the tumor, known as Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG), is a very rare and aggressive form of cancer typically found in children ages 5-9. Only 200-300 children in the United States each year are diagnosed with DIPG as they struggle to find a cure. This type of tumor is located at the base of the brain (brainstem) and the top of the spine. Over time, it will impact all of Jordyn’s essential bodily functions: heartbeat, breathing, swallowing, eyesight and balance. My brother Mike, sister in law Joanna, their son Alex, age two (2), and our families are shattered by this diagnosis. Doctors at The IWK Children’s Hospital in Halifax, NS have informed us that radiation treatments are the best we can do as we aim to keep Jordyn comfortable for her remaining time. We struggle to grasp what we are being told, and will exhaust every resource available in our fight.With all of these efforts comes a financial burden that no family should have to worry about while desperately trying to save the life of their child. Jordyn is the eldest of Mike and Joanna and shines bright amongst her brother and 5 cousins! Jordyn has spunk, sass and a fun personality. She likes to dance, ride her bike, fish, play silly games and is a practical joke enthusiast. In fact, it’s hard to find one picture where she isn’t making someone smile. She loves her grandparents and being with her family and friends. Losing Jordyn will leave a dimness in so many lives where light presently shines so bright. Please help Mike, Joanna and Alex by sending your strongest and most positive vibes to Jordyn and our family. All donations are deeply appreciated and will allow us to do whatever needs to be done to give Jordyn a fighting chance in the limited time we have.Thank you from the depth of my soul and bottom of my heart. Uncle Chris

name: Contra el Cáncer
text: Mi nombre es Joan Beltré Lamentablemente a mis 24 años de edad me diagnosticaron cancer del pulmón etapa 4, causándome metástasis en el cerebro (Tipo de cancer Small cell lung) este tipo de cancer es común en personas de mayor edad ( Ancianos ) y personas que suelen fumar, los Doctores todavía no encuentran la explicación a mi caso por ser joven y no fumar.Por este medio mi familia y yo pedimos de su colaboración para un tratamiento que me puede ayudar a mejorar esta condición y poder compartir más tiempo con mi hija de 7 meses.De ante mano quiero Darles las gracias a todos los que me puedan ayudar para llegar a esta meta de mi recuperación.My name is Joan BeltreUnfortunately, at age 24, I was diagnosed with stage 4 lung cancer, causing brain metastasis (Cancer type Small cell lung). This type of cancer is common in older people ( elderly) and people who tend to smoke, Doctors  still do not find the explanation for my case being that I am  young and do not smoke.My family and I ask for your help for a treatment that can help me improve this condition. So that I will be able to share more time with my 7 month old daughter.Beforehand I want to thank all those who can help me to reach this goal for my recovery.

name: Elisa is Fighting against cancer
text: Elisa has lung cancer. She wants to live to see her two children grow up and achieve their goals. Her treatment is expensive, and she has to travel from Japan to Mexico. Expenses are very high, and she needs support to cover these expenses. We can help her. We can contribute to help her to live.

name: Alex's Cancer Fight
text: My little bother, Alex, was recently diagnosed with Stage II Hodgkins Lymphoma. He will be starting Chemotherapy at the end of the month, which could take 4-6 months and possibly Radiation to kill the Cancer. Alex currently works as a Substitute Teacher and bartends to earn a living. He has insurance, but there are still gaps in his coverage and a lot of expenses will not be covered. Without a big income, it will be a big challenge for him to pay medical bills, rent, utilities, groceries,  student loans, etc. Any type of donation would be appreciated as our family gets through this difficult time. Alex is always there for anyone who needs him, so hopefully his warriors can help him fight this battle to get through his.

name: Help Meika in her fight with cancer
text: Meika has started her battle with Cancer. The next 12 months are going to be very emotional, stressful, angry and a sad rollercoaster of emotions for Tegan, Kaylem, Archer (2 yrs of age), Daisy (4 months of age) and especially for meika. This young family’s world was turned upside down in an instant and the timing couldn’t have been worse - a week before Christmas.It is every parent’s worst nightmare seeing their child so sick and frightened, and then having to undergo chemotherapy.To provide Meika with the love and support, cuddles and kisses she needs so she doesn’t have to fight this battle alone, Tegan will need to spend long periods of time away from her young family.Moving off the farm may be their only option as during chemo Meika needs to stay away from dirt or any unsafe conditions as she will be highly prone to infection.Dealing with financial pressures whilst keeping strong for Meika will not be easy for the family, and while we can’t take any of Meika’s pain away we CAN come together and help to ease those pressures.Please join us, Team Meika so we can help this beautiful family and provide a little comfort during this difficult time.Tegan writes to below:“She has rhabdomyosarcoma. It presented as a droopy eyelid, headaches and generally unwell. Taken to the doctors for tummy pains told it was anxiety.The mass was removed very quickly. The doctors wanted it out within a matter of hours as they didnt want it to spread anywhere else.It's a very aggressive cancer. If found early its treatable.Its been almost a month since my beautiful, energetic, healthy 9 year old was diagnosed.This is what it looks like when your world is turned upside down, crushed into a million pieces, shaken to the core. There isn't really any way to accurately describe it.There's been vomit, tears, begging it to stop because I can't take it anymore. The multiple surgeries.The sympathetic looks. The doctors and nurses that pile into the room at a moments notice. My child looking at me trying to read my face to see if what they are saying is good or bad news. The million drugs pumping into my babies body to try and stop the pain and nausea.This shit sucks. It sucks big time.We've just finished the 1st round of chemotherapy. She vomited until she had nothing left. She cried and cried and cried. Asked me why does it have to be so hard, I can't do this. Heartbroken doesnt even come close.But one thing about my little fighter is certain. She will beat this. Her positive and funny words run through my head every day.”

name: Mike's brain cancer battle-medical
text: On Saturday November 25, 2017 Mike was at a private airport in Las Vegas, having just been hired as a helicopter pilot to do tours over the Las Vegas Strip, and around the area. He had just moved back to Las Vegas only days before. He was very excited to begin this new chapter in his life, having years of experience as a tour pilot in Las Vegas, the Grand Canyon and Chicago. In the days leading up to this particular Saturday, he was experiencing terrible headaches. Within the hour of taking passengers up on his first flight, he fell to the ground in a grand-mal seizure. He was transported to the hospital by ambulance, where a CT and MRI showed 3 lesions in his brain. In the week that followed, a spinal tap and other tests ruled out the possibilities of other disease / disorders.It was determined, he needed surgery, to remove as much of the tumor for biopsy as possible, and after pathology from labs in Las Vegas and Mayo Clinic, it was determined that Mike has brain cancer. What was not determined, was the type or stage of cancer he has. The possibility now to do more brain surgery to remove the tumors is not an option, and he was told by his neurosurgeon that Las Vegas has no place for him to receive any treatment.Doing research now for the best possible center to determine what the exact type of cancer he has and  treatment, is our number one priority. It is a reality now that he’ll have to relocate soon to another part of the country.The large medical expenses for him are mounting very quickly. The medicines for swelling in the brain and anti-seizure, the cost of relocating, housing, not being able to work, and Cobra coverage for insurance, is very high to name a few.If you would be willing to consider in any way, helping offset the costs of all of this unexpected turn of life events, it would be so greatly appreciated. It is a very urgent situation. There would be no words adequate enough to express our gratitude to you.  Thank you so very much for your continued thoughts and prayers for Mike and Angie and the family.

name: Garreans Family Cancer Fund
text: As most of you maybe aware, my brother Kirk (49) has recently been diagnosed with bladder cancer that may also possibly be in his kidneys and prostate as well.  He owns his own business setting up and running video productions  for big conferences around the world.  Now that he is getting ready to start treatment for his cancer he will not be able to work since his work  requires travel and he will need to be home for all of his treatments. Since he will be unable to work he will have no income during this time and is very stressed right now about how he will be able to provide for his wife and 2 kids. Many people have asked what they can do? I'm setting this page up to raise money for him to get through financially during this very difficult time and to help pay for medical bills. If you can't contribute financially we understand and do appreciate all of your prayers!

name: Justaes' fight against cancer
text:
Justaes Richards came to the US to study and play soccer at Coastal Bend College, a Community College in Beeville, Texas. He even came to stay a while with me and my family in Frederick, Maryland before he went to college. While in college, he suffered a soccer injury which later became a cracked rib injury. He left Coastal Bend and went back to UK to continue his therapy. 
His cracked ribs were healed but his pains continued. And it got worse. So after so many hospital visits and tests the doctors discovered that he has rare CANCER called SARCOMA. The technical name is Metastatic Epithelioid Haemangio Endothelioma. 

"It is not operable because of the location of the tumor, unfortunately. He will start receiving strong chemotherapy from Friday 18.1.2019. But we're unsure if thistreatment will help him. The Orthodox medicine has reached its limits it seems at the moment.Since his immune system is weak the family is planing to add holistic treatment as well." , said Helen Richards, his mom.

You can imagine how devastating it is for him and his family and friends. His whole family are living in Ghana now so his father Mr. Paul Richards left the rest of the family to go and look after Him in UK. Since his father Paul left their business in Ghana to go and take care of him their financial resources have been severely depleted and Justaes' medical bills are still piling up as well. 

Therefore, we are sincerely asking friends, family and wellwishers for contributions to pay for Justaes' mounting medical bills and living expenses. It will also help the family to travel to UK to see Justaes.

name: Angela's Cancer Can't Wait
text: EMERGENCY: Angela needs $450 a week to travel to a clinical trial: her best hope for living with incurable cancer.In June 2018, a clinical trial at Columbia Presbyterian accepted Angela for treatment: incredible news! But travelling the 230 miles from the Ithaca area to NYC every week is more than she can afford. Funds raised cover fuel and car maintenance expenses, tolls, meals, parking, and unpaid time off work (by far the greatest cost).  Because the costs are ongoing, a small regular donation will be just as valuable (if not more so) than a larger one-off donation.  Angela and her friends have applied for non-profit help, but cancer can't wait.  Angela began treatment several weeks ago, and her expenses are mounting rapidly.In May 2015, what Angela thought was an optical migraine turned out to be a melanoma in her left eye. She lost her eye to surgery.  A fall 2017 scan and biopsy showed that her melanoma had metastasized.  Stage 4 metastatic melanoma is currently considered incurable, but this trial can extend her life,  even to the point where more and better treatment options are possible.The trial is physically and mentally grueling, and may continue for as long as 18 months. We can't change Angela's diagnosis, but raising funds to help her cover this cost is one way we can lighten the load for Angela and her children.Angela is wise, empathetic, and hilarious. She loves her children, Lilly, Gavin, Ewan, and Lonan; and Orrin, her little grandson. The last thing Angela and her family need is to worry about the costs associated with treatment.

name: Support Tony's Cancer Fight
text: Tony Hornsby was recently diagnosed with stage-4 head and neck cancer. He will start radiation and chemotherapy at the UF Cancer Center in Orlando. If you know Tony, you know what an amazing and selfless person he is. Tony, always puts family and other people's needs before his own. Thus, he has been an influence in many people's lives. This is a challenging and difficult time for our family, but we have confidence in his team of doctors which bring a feeling of hope and peace we continually pray for.Many have asked us how they could help. As awkward as this feels to ask, medical bills (along with time off work for both dad and mom) are going to start adding up, creating a financial burden beyond what insurance will cover. Whether you can donate money or not, please offer prayers, faith, hope and love. For all of you out there living with cancer or who have a family member or loved one living with cancer, you are my absolute heroes! We are in this fight together, sending you faith, hope and prayers.

name: Help my mom beat cancer
text: Hello, my name is Ayan Hassan and I am 21 years old. I am from Ottawa Ontario, Canada. I am one of four kids whose mother is currently battling for her life. My mother is currently going through her 4th stage of pancreatic cancer. The cancer spread and got to her lungs. She is 48 years old and is the strong single mother of my siblings and I. My mom greatly appreciates the donations she’s received so far! However, the medication she's been taking has stopped working and whenever she eats-which is so little- she vomits 90 percent of the time. It is very traumatizing seeing my mom be incapable of eating healthily and getting thinner and thinner each month. On this page I have a document showing proof of my mom’s cancer tumor and I have an image of the average cost of getting surgery in Germany. Pancreatic cancer is the most dangerous and aggressive cancer, and it's also the hardest one to treat. The only treatment available for her in Canada is chemotherapy and her doctors told my mom she would only have approximately a year to live after doing so. I’ve heard a lot of survivor stories of Cancer patients -specifically pancreatic- getting surgery and it being successful. I believe this is the only thing that can save her but she is a single unemployed mother and it is around $100,000. I know it seems unrealistic but I would do anything that could possibly give her hope and a chance. She deserves to live. Getting help for something you cannot control should not be this expensive but it is. Any donation is appreciated. Please share this as much as you can. Thank you.-Ayan

name: Phase II Cancer Treatment 4 Claudia Ghetu
text: Dear Friends,Our beloved Claudia is in urgent need of medical support. In June of 2018 Claudia was diagnosed with stage 4 pancreatic cancer, which had spread to her lymph nodes, lungs, bones, and liver. Pancreatic cancer is usually terminal, especially at this stage,  and requires immediate and intense treatment. Standardized medical care guarantees only a 2% recovery rate, and requires aggressive chemotherapy and radiation, which also equally guarantees a poor and debilitating quality of life. After much prayer and research, Claudia has found a renowned alternative and integrative clinic in Mexico, just across the border from San Diego, known for its high rate of success in healing terminal cancer, and other chronic and traditionally incurable diseases. The medical tourism industry in Mexico is the highest in the world, and people from all over the globe come to get cured. Treatments which are efficient in curing cancer and other chronic diseases, which are not FDA approved in the US save people's lives here. Stem cell therapy, immunotherapies and metabolic therapies, including vaccines made from your own blood and body are at the forefront of healing people who, like Claudia, were given a life sentence back home. Her doctor has been at the forefront of curing cancer for 25 years, and he is a world renowned immunologist, who patented his own successful anti-cancer vaccine.  Powerful anti-cancer natural vaccines, supplements and antioxidants in the forms of IV's are administered daily to support the immune system, with a very low dose of insulin targeted chemotherapy which often has no side effects.  Claudia's sensitive system would not allow for full dose radiation and chemotherapy which was the only option in the States, and which would have only guaranteed her a couple of extra months to live with no chance of survival. Please read Claudia's recent blog and account of the medical industry in Mexico, and how you and others can also be saved from certain death by thinking outside of the box, and looking at alternative treatments outside the US. "If you have  health insurance, that is actually your Death Insurance," Claudia wrote. Find out why, and about her first hand account talking to patients for the past 6 months who were sent home to die, but were saved coming to Mexico, and are now in remission!"Dying To Live In Mexico:"  https://claudiaghetuwellness.com/2018/11/23/dying-to-live-in-mexico/Needless to say, Claudia's insurance will not pay for the kind of treatment she has chosen. Insurance companies profit from the trillion dollar pharmaceutical global industry, with cancer treatment being at the top driving our economy! So, all of Claudia's costs are out of pocket! As you’ll see from her updates, she is making significant progress, and would have not otherwise succeeded in making it this far with traditional treatment.  The 100% standardized chemo therapy dosage, as it was relayed to her by her first integrative oncologist back in July, would have put her in a coma in less than a month.  Many people die from chemotherapy and radiation, and Claudia didn't want to ever undergo that inhumane and antiquated treatment, when there are in fact integrative and alternative options which guarantee a good chance of success even when dealing with pancreatic cancer. Also as a holistic health consultant, who has always believed in natural methods for healing the mind and body, Claudia knew immediately she wanted non-traditional and compassionate care,  in alignment with her own personal philosophy and spiritual core beliefs.  Initially the money required for treatment and the goal posted was $50K, which was to cover only the first 6-8 weeks of treatment, however after many subsequent tests Claudia and as per her doctors’  assessments, she needs to continue with 10 more months of medical care. In October Claudia had a set-back due to the metastasis in her bones, after she had made great improvements on her pancreas and liver, with tumors shrinking  at an accelerated rate, which impressed all the doctors.  She nearly lost her life, as she became suddenly incapacitated with excruciating pain in the spine and throughout all her  bones and muscles. Part of the reason was because she had taken a break from treatment and switched clinics, and was also low on funds and could not continue her treatment without interruption. This is when all the amazing people like you, kicked it and helped her find her current doctor and clinic which have saved her life. Her kind and extremely compassionate doctor, who took her in despite her lack of funds in October,  is a world renowned immunologist, and has successfully treated many well known people and alternative care advocates, including Suzanne Summers who continues to refer patients to hime, and credits him for saving her life! If you would like to find out who he is, you can contact Claudia directly. Claudia has applied for Social Security Disability Benefits which will not be available until next year. She has gone for the past 6 months without any government support, even though in her case they should have started paying her within a month of applying (July) due to the compassionate act for terminally ill cancer patients.  Your continued support will be of immense help, even once her small social security stipend kicks in early next year, as that would only cover the cost of rent and basic food. Claudia has always believed that true healing comes from  connecting to our divine nature, a supportive and spiritual environment, and from deep within ourselves. Her belief in God is unwavering and she is filled with divine gratitude, knowing that she was given this obstacle to overcome, only to transcend beyond worldly limitations and help others. As an Integrative Holistic Health Counselor, Nutritional Chef, and yoga and meditation teacher, she lives what she teaches  and is known to go the extra mile to empower, support,  and inspire those around her.  Even a few days before she was diagnosed, short of energy and barely able to eat, she visited someone in the hospital to give them wellness and spiritual counseling, and cooked for her clients until the day she had to go to the emergency room, making sure they wouldn’t miss out on their healthy meals. She has dedicated her life to helping others facing mental, emotional and physical challenges, and those seeking to transition to a healthier mind-body-spirit lifestyle. Now, she is the one in need of our support. She is using her own healing modalities to heal herself combined with the help of an amazing team of alternative doctors, who support her holistic choices, providing her with the compassion and motivation which she has always shown to others. She bravely turned down traditional chemotherapy and radiation treatments, which would only give her a 2% chance of survival. Those who know her well call her a warrior! She is not only fighting for her own life, but as she so often says “I am here fighting for everyone, so they can learn through me that cancer too can be overcome with the right integrative medical treatment and support, and through sheer faith, and will power!” Let’s help her achieve her goal, her medical expenses will far extend the amount we are asking. Please share this link with your various social media contacts or personal acquaintances, and kindly add a personal message to it, as this seems to make a big difference. You can read more about Claudia’s remarkable and brave story via her recent blog on her website ClaudiaGhetuWellness “How Cancer is Healing Me!” Claudia wants to live and help others by giving back. So many people like her are given a death sentence, but cancer doesn’t have to be an end, but a beginning!Claudia and her family are deeply grateful for your love, prayers and support.   With much love and gratitude.

name: Alex Obendorf;  Conquering Cancer
text: My name is Alex Obendorf. I am 23 years old and a Senior at West Virginia University studying International Studies with an emphasis in Business. While attending WVU I was able to be a part of the Collegiate Swimming and Diving Teams. Due to illness I had to withdraw from my classes last semester, but plan on finishing my degree this Spring. I hope to then enter a Master's Program in Mental Health and Rehabilitation Counseling to give me the opportunity to help people who may be going through similar struggles to the ones I have faced. I was diagnosed with Stage 3 Testicular Cancer in July of 2018, and received a surgery to remove the mass. Upon completion of the surgery the cancer was found to have moved to my Lymph Nodes. I have since been through Four rounds of Chemotherapy, was hospitalized twice, and now am facing another surgery to remove a mass in my Abdomen & Lymph Nodes.Today I received news that the mass has encapsulated my Aorta and also my Inferior Vena Cava. I have what is called a mixed germ cell tumor which contained 4 different kinds of Cancer. The Chemotherapy killed 3 of the 4 types of Cancer, but didn't affect the last kind in the mass which is bigger than my liver. I now am forced to  schedule a 6 to 8 hour surgery at Indiana University to remove it.  My doctors here recommended that I seek treatment in Indiana because this type of surgery is outside of the areas of expertise of my team and the doctors in Indiana deal with this type of surgery on a more frequent basis.  It is about a five hour trip there and I will be hospitalized for at least 4 days which only adds to my medical expenses as well as the cost of travel and lodging for me and my loved ones. I haven't been able to work due to treatment and now with the completion of my Chemo the Medical Bills are substantial. Anything you can give would be more than appreciated. My family and I would be eternally grateful for your contributions and even if you can't give anything sharing this fundraiser would mean the world to us.I want to thank each and everyone who has shared, and generously donated to make this opportunity possible. I am truly grateful to have the continued love and support throughout this challenging period in my life. Xox#ObendorfStrong

name: Ayudémos a Sebastían! Help Sebastian fight cancer
text: Sebastián es un joven de 22 años con muchos sueños y metas por cumplir. En diciembre de 2018 fue diagnosticado con un tumor en el cerebro que resultó ser maligno; desde entonces continúa internado en el Instituto Nacional de Neurología y Neurocirugía en Ciudad de México. Al día de hoy, ha sido intervenido quirúrgicamente en 7 ocasiones, la mayoría de ellas han sido producto de una serie de complicaciones que lo han mantenido como paciente de la cama 7 en terapia intensiva - los médicos prevén que se mantendrá ahí de 4-6 semanas más. La lucha por la vida de Sebastián continúa. Han sido muchas las personas que han aportado alguna donación al día de hoy, pero desafortunadamente, Sebastián aún tiene un largo camino que recorrer. Por esto, les pedimos continúen compartiendo para que el dinero sea la menor de las preocupaciones en su camino a la recuperación. Nosotros, los tíos de Sebastián, no tenemos más que agradecerles desde el fondo de nuestro corazón, todos los mensajes de cariño y donaciones que han realizado. Su generosidad ha salvado la vida de nuestro sobrino. ¡Mil veces gracias! Sus tíos, Andrea Alberdi Andrew RussellAnn RussellSebastián is a young man with so many hopes and dreams; he’s only 22 y/o and has been diagnosed with brain cancer. He was first operated on in Dec. 2018 and has remained a patient in intensive care in the Instituto Nacional de Neurología y Neurocirugía in Mexico City since then. He’s had many health complications that have resulted in 6 other surgeries. We want nothing more than for Sebastian to come back home. Your generous donations have helped save his life. Unfortunately, as a cancer patient, he still has a long road to recovery. Thank you so much for your kind, loving messages and for continuing to share Sebastian’s story. His aunts and uncle,Andrea Alberdi Andrew RussellAnn Russell

name: Carmen Cardenas Zamora Funeral
text: Friends and family, we ask that we come together to support the Cardenas Zamora family during this difficult time. Our friend, Carmen lost her battle to cancer on June 9th. Anyone who knew Carmen, knew the kindness of her heart and there is a loss in words in describing what her departure means to us. Carmen and her parents had recently traveled to Houston, Tx. to continue her cancer treatments. As parents, they did all that was in their power to help their daughter gain her health back. God's plan was different. Please help us extend help to the Cardenas Zamora family for funeral expenses for their daughter. Any help is appreciated. Thank you in advance for your support. Amigos y familia, les pedimos que nos unamos en apoyo a la familia Cardenas Zamora durante estos momentos difíciles. Nuestra querida amiga, Carmen (Carmelita, como muchos la recordaremos) perdió su batalla contra el cancer el 9 de Junio. Quien conoció  a Carmen, sabrá que fue una persona con un corazón lleno de bondad y una fortaleza enorme pues lucho hasta el último momento. Faltan palabras para describir lo que su partida significa para todos nosotros. Carmen, junto con sus padres habían viajado a Houston, Tx. recientemente para continuar sus tratamientos. Como padres, ellos hicieron todo lo que estaba en sus manos para regresarle la salud a su hija. Pero Dios tenía otros planes para ella. Les pedimos que nos unamos en oración y le extendamos la ayuda a la familia Cardenas Zamora para los servicios funebres de su hija.  Cualquier ayuda sera apreciada. Muchas gracias de antemano por su apoyo.

name: Help Hannah battle cancer
text: Hannah needs our help in her battle with cancer. She needs love and support but also needs financial help to ensure she has a home to go to after her fight.At 3 years old Hannah was diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). At this time she went through 27 months of chemotherapy resulting in 10 months of being cancer free.At age 6 she had a relapse. She had more chemotherapy then recieved a bone marrow transplant. The transplant required her to be in isolation for the following year to protect her against infection and rejection. For 7 years she was in remission!In June 2016 at age 13 Hannah was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia (AML). She spent 3 months at Hasbro Childrens Hospital recieving massive chemotherapy. Hannah's mother, Debbe, fights this battle with her as a single mother and her sole support. She has not left Hannah's side once spending her nights sleeping in a chair at her bedside. Debbe is a former head start teacher and most recently worked at Hannahs school, all saints academy in middletown RI. Her job has been put on hold as her priority has needed to become her daughters health. Their lives revolve around trips between providence and Boston for treatments and the fight against cancer. Looming over their heads are enormous medical expenses. The mortgage is 4 months behind and they are at risk of losing their home. There house phone has been shut off with other utilities soon to follow. There isn't money to shop for groceries or put gas in the car. Hannah is now waiting for her second bone marrow transplant. After the transplant Debbe and Hannah will need to spend 3 months in the ronald mcdonald house in boston to be closely monitored. If the transplant is successful she will return home for another year of isolation to prevent rejection and infection.At the age of 13 Hannah has endured more pain, suffering and struggle there many of us will face in a lifetime. Lets come together as a community to ensure Hannah will have a roof over her head, food to eat and heat until her mother is able to return to work.She needs us! Lets make this go viral!! Please help and please share. Anything helps.

name: BUENA OBRA - Maldito Cancer
text: No siempre se puede ganar la batalla contra el cancer... pero una misma familia esta pasando por esta pesadilla por SEGUNDA OCASION.  Perdieron un hijo hace varios años por culpa del cancer.  Ahora su hija de 6 años está luchando tambien.  AYUDANOS a aliviar un poco esta pesada carga.  GRACIAS.

name: Zeta Lip Sync for Breast Cancer!
text: Alpha Xi Delta's Pledge Class of 2018 here at UCF is competing in our first dance contest of the year, Zeta Lip Sync. Zeta Lip Sync raises money for Breast Cancer Awareness! It would mean so much if you would donate just a little bit to this amazing  organization that is very near dear to our hearts :)

name: Support Stephanie’s Cancer Fight
text: Many of you know Stephanie VanHoecke was recently diagnosed with Breast Cancer just before Christmas. Since then, the doctors have determined a treatment plan which will include surgery and chemotherapy over the next 6 months.  During this time Stephanie will not be able to work so let’s bless their family. Join us in supporting them so they don’t have to stress over the financial burden of copayments, deductibles, and other medical costs during this time.“So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God.  I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.” Isaiah 41:10

name: Brady Maczek's Fight Against Cancer
text: Marriage is supposed to be a time of happiness and new adventures. Five days after Brady and Coral’s wedding, they were handed an adventure that no one should have to embark on. Brady was diagnosed with stage four metastatic cancer at the age of 28. He was urgently admitted to the oncology unit in Regina for chemotherapy. He spent the firsts few months of marriage in the hospital while Coral remained diligently at his bedside. Because of this, Coral was unable to work for the majority of his chemo treatments. Although Brady has completed chemo, they now have to fly to Vancouver for surgery on Christmas Eve to remove one of the few masses left. This is the first of possibly multiple surgeries. The Maczek’s will be spending their first Christmas as a married couple in the hospital and recovering from major surgery. Brady and Coral are required to stay in Vancouver for a few days once discharged to ensure everything goes well before flying back to Saskatchewan. Any funds raised will go towards flights, accommodation, food and incidentals as these are the responsibility of Brady and Coral. Any additional funds raised will be used for this and possible follow up surgeries that Brady needs out of province. Any participation will be greatly appreciated. ** Brady and Coral would like to spend an evening with everyone before they fly to Vancouver. We are currently looking into setting up a pizza/pasta fundraiser for some time before they leave. If you would like to attend this event we will hopefully post an update in the near future about it. Thanks to everyone for their participation! -Kate

name: Arnold.Brutus Cancer Operation
text: Arnold has cancer, it’s a lump in his side and expensive to remove.It’s coming out and he will have a small amount if follow up work and scans to confirm it’s all been found.Anything helps, and is of course appreciated to help us through this time and provide the care he needs.

name: Amber's Fight For Life Against Stage IV Cancer
text: If you're fortunate enough to know Amber Ross, you know that she is one of a kind, no doubt! I honestly don't really know where to begin in writing this but I do know she needs some help. I'm reaching out to you in hopes that you would be willing to help her get the care she needs. She was recently diagnosed with Stage IV Breast Cancer that has metastasized to her bones. She has multiple lesions in several places. Stage IV is the most advanced stage of cancer and there is no cure. Our mother, Amber, is a strong woman of faith and she refuses to accept a death sentence so she is buckling down to fight this thing with all that is within her! Some of you may know, she has had breast cancer twice before and she rocked it like it was the common cold. This cancer is proving to be quite a bit more aggressive and, statistically speaking, has a much lower survival rate. The median survival rate is 3 years. Our family refuses to accept this but quick action is needed. She wants to take the alternative medicine route so we have been gathering information on Autohemotherapy. This is a newer technology that is, unfortunately, not covered by insurance. This treatment has some awesome success stories but it doesn't come without a price, of course! It is quite expensive but life is priceless. The problem is that we don't have the money to pay for this on our own. It is $600 for every session. Patients have seen favorable results within 6-10 sessions. Similar cases have shown the best results between 15-25 sessions. Each session will last about 5-6 hours so she'll be taking time off from work at least twice a week to receive this treatment. I can imagine that you are thinking this sounds absurdly expensive and, honestly, I agree. But I can't let price be a factor so I'm laying pride aside and asking for you to please help fight this nasty disease! As the treatments progress, they will be monitoring her bloodwork to determine whether or not it is accomplishing the goal at hand (which is killing the cancer cells in her body). If for some reason, this treatment becomes ineffective, Plan B will be put into motion. Plan B is traveling just over 600 miles to MD Anderson in Houston, Texas. Treatment costs should minimize with this option, due to insurance, but there would inevitably be travels costs and several week-long stays resulting in expenses that we just simply do not have. I give you my word that whatever you have in your heart to donate will absolutely go toward the array of expenses incurred from our mother's care (treatments, lodging, travel, etc.). Any donation received will be such a blessing and relief. We pray God's favor on you and that you never have a reason to make a request such as this. Thank you for all your help! We've set our initial goal at $3,600 just so we can get her started with treatment, as time is of the essence. The costs will undoubtedly amount to much more than this but prompt action is vital. If you have any questions PLEASE reach out! I would be more than happy to give more details or information that I may have forgotten to include! You can reach me via email at t.jablanski@hotmail.com or Facebook Messenger facebook.com/tjablanski.

name: Emily Adams Loeschke Breast Cancer Treatment Fund
text: On December 17th my dear friend, Emily Adams Loeschke, was told she has Stage 4 Metastatic Breast Cancer and her life was forever changed.  Please help me to raise money for Emily to help with the financial hardship she will now continually endure as she fights for a cure for her cancer.  Emily had been having back aches since September 2018. She had X rays and it showed a slip disc, but it never got better it just kept moving. She kept on her doctor and a MRI proved concerning. They then preformed a  CT scan that showed a large mass in her breast, 2 in her lymph nodes and a very concerning mass in her hip.  On Christmas Eve Emily immediately started Chemotherapy.  Emily found out that her cancer has a less than 5% chance of going away or “beating it”.  Even if all her scans are clean for 5-10 years that doesn’t mean she will get to ever stop treatment.  If she stops treatment there could be microorganisms of cancer that are undetectable by scans and it could come back.  In this case there is a chance that her body will have built an immunity to the treatment that was keeping her alive and will not work as well if she ever needs to pick up treatment again.  The plan now is to continue with infusions every 3 weeks, not to get rid of the cancer but to help her live as long as possible.  She is looking into alternative medicine options as well and continues to remain positive, taking each day as it comes!Emily is a bright light in my heart and to those who love her.  She NEVER will miss out on a good time with her friends and family, and brings laughter to all around her.  She is also the person that everyone comes to when they need someone to listen or shoulder to cry on.  She is compassionate with all around her and wants all to be happy and having FUN!  PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE:  Help me repay this beautiful, kind soul for all she has ever done for everyone else.

name: Help Nevena Fight Cancer
text: I’ve known Nevena since my first year in the US. Wow, that’s 18 years now…If you’ve ever had the chance to know her, whether it’s from Gateway 26, as an employee or a customer, or as a neighbor, or a friend, or an acquaintance, you know that she is kind, giving and always there when you need her help. She is a wonderful and caring mother to her 5 year old son and a loving wife. Well, this time Nevena needs our help, our support and generosity. She needs us in the hardest of times, as she is battling breast cancer. Nevena was diagnosed with triple-negative, pretty invasive and fast developing breast cancer and had to start treatments immediately after her diagnosis, during a time when she had NO health insurance coverage. This diagnosis came at the worst of times, right before the holidays. Needless to say, the cost of treatments, scans, test and medications are in the thousands by now (over $20,000 at this time) and are all out of pocket expense. And this is just the beginning. She needs to go through 5 more rounds of chemo, followed by a surgery and possibly radiation. It has become quite overwhelming for her and her family and the bills just keep coming in. Please consider any donation amount, so we can help Nevena and ease her worries, because the last thing someone needs during their fight with cancer is worrying about medical bills.  I know she has touched the hearts of many people over the years and I hope everyone finds it in their hearts to give back. Thank you for your generosity! Please share this page to help us spread the word!

name: Help Damien Battle Cancer
text: Damien Hernandez has been a stalwart of the bar and service industry for many years and a beloved member of the Hemlock family for over 4 years. He embodies the words Husband, Father and Friend. Damien has been in poor health for the better part of the past year. He has been in and out of the hospital for unresolved issues, and on July 13, 2017 he was readmitted to the hospital where doctors found and removed a 10MM mass from his lower intestine. The doctors later concluded that the mass was cancerous and a sign of a much larger problem - Damien has been diagnosed with STAGE 4 COLON CANCER. We are fighting to ensure he has more time with his wife and son. Though he will begin an aggressive treatment in the coming weeks, his family is looking into all treatment possibilities to help prolong his life. Funds are needed to help with medical costs as well as the cost of living for himself, his wife Janessa and 8 year old son JD, as treatment will leave him unable to work. All funds will go directly to Damien and his family. Please help us support Damien and his family as he has supported the bars and clubs you have loved over the years.While we are actively involved in the GoFundMe Campaign we need your help to make our efforts go even further! You can help us increase Damien’s access to treatment and quality of life as he continues his fight. Your support is crucial to our efforts to help in the battle. If you’re able, we’d love it if you could make a donation of to help us achieve our mission and see that Damien gets as many happy days as he can with Janessa, his son JD and the rest of his family.Thank you in advance for your contribution.

name: Greta's battle against cancer
text: Update from September 20, 2017:The most beautiful, fantastic, sweet, precious girl left us early this morning. Greta took her last breath snuggled between her Mama and DadaThe pain we feel is unbearable, and words cannot express how much we already miss her, but we know our girl is no longer suffering. Our hearts are broken and will NEVER be the same. We LOVE you Miss Greta. #gladiatorgreta-----------------------------------------------------------------------This is Greta! And this is the story of Greta's battle with cancer...Greta was a happy, healthy energetic baby. Then she started having some vague symptoms, unexplained fever, a little nausea, less stamina. After various tests Greta went for an ultrasound and that's when our world was forever changed. The scans showed Greta had a mass on her liver. In September 2015, days before she turned 2 years old, Greta was diagnosed with Hepatoblastoma – an extremely rare liver cancer found in fewer than 1 in a million children.Greta started her first chemo treatment on her 2nd birthday. She tolerated her treatment extremely well!  Though she lost her hair and had to be isolated because of low immunity, Greta remained a happy, exuberant child. At the end of March 2016 – after 2 major surgeries, 10 chemotherapy sessions and endless pokes and procedures, she was done her treatment and had "no evidence of disease". The Oncologists said recurrence was unlikely. We were overjoyed!  We enjoyed the summer with Greta and her big brother Ben. Spending lots of time at the lake and watching her change from a baby to a little girl. Then, on a routine follow up doctor visit, we had disturbing results from a blood test - it looked like the cancer was back. More tests and scans revealed that it was. The good news was that it had not metastasized. We started chemo all over again almost exactly a year after the first round and were told she would need a liver transplant. We have been working extensively with doctors in Calgary, Toronto and Cincinnati on how best to take care of Greta’s relapsed hepatoblastoma (liver cancer).  Our Canadian doctors have done everything they can to help but, in this case, our system is far behind many of the large centers in the world.Dr. Geller, a paediatric oncologist at Cincinnati Children’s Hospital, has a special interest in hepatoblastoma and much more experience than any Canadian doctors. . He has spoken with us at length about Greta's situation and has offered to help in any way he can. With being denied a transplant in Canada, he is our only chance to get Greta a healthy liver. He has been working closely with our Canadian doctors but is convinced he can do more to help Greta than is possible here. In his practice he has been personally been involved in 9 rescue liver transplants (transplant after resection) and 8 of these children are doing well! Dr. Geller believes Greta has and deserves a shot at life.But it is expensive! We are travelling to Cincinnati right away to start the evaluation process for a possible liver transplant and a procedure called T.A.R.E  which will help to hopefully stabilize her tumour and prevent it from spreading beyond her liver but we need approximately  $150K US for the procedure.  However, there is a chance they would be able to transplant right away. This would require A LOT more money.We asked for the cost of this treatment and were told that for initial evaluation, transplant surgery and follow up care and chemo until she can return home it would be USD $1.2M.  Above this would be travel and living expenses for us, Greta's parents, while she is in Cincinnati. At this time, AB Health Care will not be covering the cost of Greta’s transplant surgery.We need help! And we need it right away. Greta's life depends on it. So much of the journey through childhood cancer is lonely and isolating, but our friends and family have rallied around to support us as best they can. And we need you now more than ever. Every single dollar will help give Greta a chance at life, a chance she deserves.  If any funds collected are unused for Greta's care we will donate them to a Children's cancer care/research charity. Words cannot express how greatful we are for all the support and donations. Thank you!Love Steve, Lindsey, Ben and Greta xoxoInformation requested by GoFundMe:My name is Katie Findlay and I am a long time family friend working on behalf of the Marofke's to raise money to help Greta. The money will be used to cover the cost of Greta's transplant surgery and subsequent medical costs associated with the surgery. The funds go directly to Lindsey Marofke as the sole collector on the GoFundMe account. Lindsey withdraws funds as needed to pay for the medical expenses.

name: Gavin Sheppard Fights Brain Cancer
text: After experiencing double vision, and hearing loss, my 15 year-old nephew, Gavin Sheppard, was recently diagnosed with a large brain tumor. He is currently at Cooks Children's Hospital in Fort Worth Texas where he'll go in for surgery to have the tumor removed on Monday, August 20th.  We've been told by his neurosurgeon that the tumor is most likely an ependymoma, which is a cancerous tumor that does not respond to Chemo therapy. Because of this, the tumor will need to be completely removed, even if it means causing permanent damage to Gavin's primary motor skills.As if this devastating news isn't enough, my sister Tiffany's health insurance doesn't kick in until September 1st (waiting for surgery isn't an option because the tumor could spread further down Gavin's spine).  She is a single mother, raising her 3  kids entirely on her own, and will now be facing hundreds of thousands dollars in medical bills. Words cannot even adequately describe the love and prayers that we've felt at this time.We've been contacted by numerous family and friends who've all asked if there is anything they could do to help; so we thought it would be a good idea to get this gofundme going so Tiffany can get a jump start on tackling Gavin's medical bills. We will continue to post updates on Gavin here, if you wish to follow along. Thanks so much!

name: Sabrina Girard - Her Battle with Cancer
text: Ken and Sabrina Girard were once high school sweethearts who knew from a young age that they belonged together. After graduating high school, they married, and started a family. Ken and Sabrina now live in the small upstate New York town of Rotterdam with their children, Kenny Jr. (14) and Angelina (11) who are both very active in sports in the Mohonasen School District. In 2011, at the young age of 34, Sabrina noticed a rash on her skin and made an appointment with her primary doctor. After months of being treated for psoriasis and eczema with no relief, her doctor diagnosed Sabrina with Cutaneous T-Cell Lymphoma, also known as CTCL. Soon after, Sabrina was referred to a specialist at Yale University to begin treatment.In January of 2012, Sabrina began intense treatment for Sezary Syndrome, the most aggressive form of CTCL. Not only does Sezary affect the skin, but also the blood and lymph nodes. Sabrina’s treatment plan consisted of travel to New Haven, Connecticut every four weeks for intense therapy, leaving her unable to work, as well as Ken and her two kids behind in New York. By early 2014, Sabrina’s skin was cleared and the Leukemia completely eliminated. Sabrina, like most people who have a form of cancer, knew that she would have to fight for life. Fast forward to October 2018 when Sabrina started to notice a familiar rash on her skin. The rashes spread quickly and began causing extreme pain all over her body. Ken and Sabrina have worked hard to sustain their home and provide for their two children. Both working full time jobs, juggling football practice with cheerleading and softball, and still finding time to be with one another. Sabrina’s fight has forced her out of work, turning a dual income household into a single income household. As Sabrina’s battle has progressed, Ken has been forced to take time from his job to care for his loving wife and their children, further reducing their household income. We are asking that family, friends, and anyone willing to help please donate to the Girard family in their time of need. Between paying thousands of dollars for treatment alone, along with travel expenses, care for the kids, food, hotels, and so much more – the Girard family needs our help. There is no donation too small. Words of encouragement and a small donation can go a long way at a time like this. Please join us in supporting this well deserving family who we all know and love.

name: Emily's Cancer Treatment
text: My sister-in-law Emily Williams is one of the most loving and generous people I've ever met. She's an amazing woman, wife, mom, coach, colleague, daughter, niece, aunt...you name it. She is filled with kindness and she is the first in line to help and support every time. Now she needs all of us who love her. She and her amazing family - Phil and Sam and Avery - could use all of our help right now. Emily has been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma stage IV.  The basics: Stage four means it has progressed to her bone marrow. It is considered "low grade and slow growing." It is not curable, but it is treatable. She's started treatment earlier this month, with antibody infusions, and will begin chemotherapy in February. The other basics: Emily's been on a health rollercoaster for the last two years, which has been both physically and financially devastating, coping first with Lyme disease, and now with this diagnosis. The expenses will continue as she treats and manages Lymphoma. However you can help is appreciated. Also, the love and care of friends is just as important as money, so don't hesitate to reach out if you'd prefer to offer assistance that isn't $.

name: Matt Turner Cancer Treatments
text: My name is Matthew Turner, I am a 22 year old college student and I have stage IV cancer. This year was to be my final year at the University of Central Florida for an electrical engineering degree. I had an internship at NASA's Kennedy Space Center working with Atlantis Education Services Space Trek summer camp program. I was able to convince Space Trek to sponsor my senior design project which was to be completed this spring. I proposed to my girlfriend of three years and we now live together. In June of this year I weighed 170 lbs (77 kilo) and decided it was time to get into shape. By September I had lost 10 lbs (4.5 kilo) and noticed a lump in my abdomen. By November it became a bulge and I decided I needed to see a doctor. I had two scans, a CT and an MRI, and by Thanksgiving week my doctor referred me to an oncologist for a potential caner diagnosis. I had a biopsy on December 4th and my doctor was able to confirm that I have a desmoplastic small cell sarcoma in my pelvis which has spread to my lungs, lymphatic system, and liver. I have spent the past week (12/18-12/23) recieving my first regiment of chemotherapy at Moffitt Cancer Center in Tampa Florida. The doctors here are confident that they can save me this time but my future is pretty bleak.To give some numbers:Sarcomas make up 1% of all cancer diagnosis, abdominal/pelvic sarcomas make up 20% of all sarcomas, and 40% of those are stage IV. The survival rates for this cancer, the chance I have of this disease recurring after remisssion, are bleak. There is a 40% three year survival rate and only a 15% five year survival rate. I have been told I will see 30 only if I'm very lucky.My luck has been pretty horrid in regards to my diagnosis but I'm not giving up. My family and my fiance's family are both dedicated to helping me beat this disease in the immediate future so I can live the remainder of my life to the absolute fullest. If there is a physical way I WILL return to school and finish my remaining classes. Once I'm well enough I WILL return to Kennedy Space Center.  To make this happen I need HELP. The only way I will survive is to focus my entire mind on staying well. I'm currently extremely healthy (except for the cancer ha) which gives me a much better shot at getting at least one good year of limited pain. I want so much more but if I can get that one year I think I can do everything I need to do. I have had an amazing life but I wanted to do so much more. I'm an inventor and hobbiest in my spare time. I've built several guitar effects pedals, a 1-watt laser, and most of a portable Nintendo 64. I still have so much to offer to the world but without assistance I will be swamped with bills. I have always earned my own way. I have worked steadily since I was 14, have always had good grades in school, and overall wanted to remain self sufficient. I hate this disease. It stole my future from me. Here are more awful numbers:I have $37,000 in student loans that I have to start making payments on in 6 months.I have already accrued $8,000 in medical bills in the past month.My living expenses are $1200 a month for now but I will have to change my diet to reduce the chance of bacterial infection. That number will rise to $1300-1400.Medical supplies to keep me alive during my treatment will cost me another $200 per month.I don't even know how much my prescription medication will cost.Any money raised from this campaign will go directly to saving my life. $5 will buy me one meal, $50 will cover the cost of traveling from Orlando to Tampa for treatment, what I'm trying to convey is that every dollar removes extra stress from my life. If getting better is the only thing I have to worry about, then I am confident that I will survive this round. I need any donations as soon as possible because medical bills are already pilling up. Once I'm well enough, I will complete my degree and can use that experience to find a job. Without my degree, I have tons of debt and no way to start paying it. If I had my degree this would be an entirely different situation. It is just not possible for me to pay off this amount of debt without a degree, but I cannot get my degree without at least starting to pay the debt off. Donating to my campaign will help ensure that once I'm well I can get back on my feet. There is no point in getting chemotherapy, potential surgery, etc. if once I'm done I will neither afford to live nor have the degree to make a decent living. Please help me. My family and I cannot do this alone.

name: Jessica Black's Journey Through Cancer
text: "sis~ter: (noun) a female sibling, the woman with whom you share your childhood, your secrets, and your clothes, the only person able to love you, protect you, and bother you at the same time."In this moment, I feel helpless when it comes to the protection part of having a sister. On 12/10, my sister Jessica's life was forever changed. What was suppose to be an in and out trip to urgent care turned into a 20 day stay in the hospital due to the discovery of 3 tumors in her chest. The oncologist believes she has a stage 4 cancer called squamous carcinoma but are still trying to figure out where the cancer originated from. It's like a Where's Waldo, but with tumors.  My name is Dianne Black from Tacoma, WA; my family and I are setting up the fund so Jessica can withdraw directly. The money will be used for her rent, car payment, insurance, and all medical bills that are not covered by medical. We are humbly asking for help with her financials so she can focus on beating the cancer. Please consider donating, but if money is not something you can give please help by sharing this campaign.Thank you!Much Love,The Black Family

name: Fighting cancer with Mark Ashman
text: While training for a 300-mile Relay race, Mark Ashman collapsed with weakness and was transported to the Hospital.  Mark was diagnosed with Hodgkins Lymphoma, and as a secondary issue, he is unable to walk or drive.   As a professional photographer, Mark has no funds coming in until he beats the disease.  Mark needs all the help he can get at the moment.  Everyone that knows Mark, or Uncle Marky as his epic parties are referred to, Knows that he is one of the most caring and generous men alive.  It's time to return the favor.  Please step up and help with whatever you can.  With your help, we'll beat this cancer and get him up walking again!!!.... This account was not made by Mark Ashman, but in support for him.   Just to clarify.  It was made for him by his friends, under his name to make all your generous donations available directly to him.

name: Fund for Mae Prill cancer surgery
text: Recently my mother Mae Prill (Nan) was diagnosed with lung cancer. After several doctor visits they determined that she is a candidate for surgery and then chemo treatment to make sure it is all gone. My mother has a long road ahead of her between doctor visits, hospital stays, surgery, chemo, etc. We are trying to take a collection for her to ease some of the stress of the expenses and let her focus on positivity and beating her cancer. Any donation would help her at this point. She said thank you, she loves you all and appreciates any help and support.

name: Amy Fujikawa Journey with Cancer & Cushing Syndrom
text: Hello Everyone, thank you for viewing our site.I would like to introduce my wife , Amy Fujikawa, 45 years old, we have have two beautiful children Devin 14 and Lilah 11.  Amy and I were married in 2001, and have been together since 1995. Amy has worked in the social welfare field for 20 years+.  She has dedicated her career to helping others.  We have lived a happy normal everyday life as most others.    Amy has always been pro active with physicals, mammograms and lived a healthy lifestyle until one day last year, around April 2018 she started feeling rundown and had chest pains  We immediately saw doctors ruling out any heart issues however; the pains kept occurring and they continued to be no explanation for the high blood pressure and other symptoms. The next test was a colonoscopy and endoscopy.  During these procedures her blood pressure was in the 200s.  The Colonoscopy showed polyps.  She was diagnosed with an Esophageal ulcer as well as stomach ulcers. We were disappointed but relieved to have answers.  Her blood pressure remained high. After many more tests they finally ordered a 24 hour urine test to check her Cortisol hormone level, blood pressure, blood glucose and many other important bodily functions.  I believe normal range for  Cortisol  levels, for her age is about 10-20 micro grams per deciliter.  Amy's were pushing over 700!!  Doctors diagnosed her with a disease I had never heard of, Cushing's Syndrome.  We did a lot of research and Amy had so many of the horrible symptoms which included extremely high blood pressure, Cushing's related diabetes, low potassium levels, weight gain and the list goes on and on.  Cushing's is caused by overactive Adrenal gland located on Kidneys or Putatary gland.  I suggest Googling to learn more about this disease which many men and women suffer for years not knowing what's wrong with them. Moving forward she had a scan performed on kidney and to our horror there was a Cancerous tumor about 3 inches in size.  We were devastated to say the least.  We worked side by side with many doctors. She had surgery on November 1st, 2018.  After surgery we got more bad news as we learned part of tumor was on a critical Vascular vein and was to risky to try to remove.  While they were exploring other organs they found that her liver was compromised with  stage 4 cancer, a very aggressive and rare form of cancer called Adrenal Cortical Carcinoma or ACC. As you can imagine this was absolutely devastating to us for the second time.  We knew we had a long battle ahead of us with the Cushing's Sydrome alone, but didn't expect what was to come.  After a week at UCI Irvine California,  Amy was able to come home. She was feeling strong and ready to battle this.  We knew Chemotherapy was to come but with ACC Chemotherapy has little effect on this type of cancer, but we were ready.  At this time the  Cushing's symptoms escalated.  Everyday she has to take medication, including  blood thinners due to a Pulmonary Embolism she suffered on top of this due to Cushing's. She has to be on Insulin to treat the high blood sugar from Cushing's.  Her body has become a pin cushion with  so many daily labs, shots and tests.  Her stomach is one huge bruise from yet another side effect of Cushing's, where body easily bruises.  She is taking so many different prescriptions to keep all of her side effects in check and they just make her feel terrible everyday.  We are currently doing chemotherapy to battle the cancer on her kidney and lungs but due to yet another set back her liver levels and white cells dropped to a dangerous level and had to postpone chemotherapy again.  The Cushing's symptoms also cause setbacks, as also it affects her mobility, and can't left her self up & down on own, and  her feet become very swollen.Just a few short months ago my wife was active and living a normal life and now she cannot go upstairs and is basically confined to wheelchair and bed and needs assistance with what we take for granted.  Normal things like walking, standing, bathing and for someone who was active and self- reliant is absolutely devastating to her. Amy rarely complains about anything even though I know deep down she is so scared. I love my wife more than anything and my children who need their mother.  We will do whatever it takes to beat these horrible diseases.  We need everyone's help in any way possible, small or large, even a simple thought or prayer would be wonderful for this long journey ahead of us.  All donations will go directly towards medical expenses. We are now finding that we need to start home health care for her which is quite costly.  It takes a village and together we can make a difference.  We thank you from our hearts for your generosity and positive thoughts and much needed prayers.  Please share to as many friends or family.  Thank you again for taking the time to read this, we know it is a lot of information, but we wanted to make sure to provide with as much details as needed to understand the complex of this.    Please free to to reach out if you have any questions.Sincerely,Steve Fujikawa

name: Help Manoj Fight Cancer
text: Help Manoj fight Cancer..            Manoj is a loving and hardworking young man, 35 years of age, full of dreams and compassion. He is my sister Poonam's husband and their son Suchit ,6 years old is a bundle of joy and innocence.             Life was full of joy and laughter till Manoj was diagnosed with Chronic Myeloid Leukaemia(CML).            Suddenly in March 2017, he started developing fever which won't go away. Bone Marrow examination was performed. The diagnose was Chornic Myeloid Leukaemia in lymphoid blast crisis stage. Manoj's case is unusual in the sense that sudden blastic transformation is rare. Every member of the family is devastated. Everyone is trying to cope up with this situation.            Manoj will need salvage therapy followed by consolidation allograft. He will also need weekly intrathecal chemotherapy. If adequate response rate is achieved, a consolidated sibling allograft will be done. Manoj's siblings are undergoing HLA-Typing as soon as possible.            No matter how strong and positively everyone in the family takes it, the whole process is taxing emotionally, physically and financially.             The harsh reality is the financial limitation. The cost has been estimated to cross $150,000, which is huge. The family is trying to cough up all their savings and seeking help.            But, this task looks upheaval without the power of helping hands.  We all are trying to rally behind Manoj and Poonam to try to raise money for the treatment and all expenses involved.The donation will cover this sudden unexpected expenses it involves.            Please, donate generously for the family to fight this battle of cancer so that it will ease the stress of sudden monetary burden.I am trying to reach out to everyone who can be someone's sunshine whenever the skies are grey.

name: Eat the Egg for Children's Cancer
text: Hey everyone! In the wake of all the negativity and hardships that have surfaced throughout this past year, my friends and I decided we should do something both fun, and impactful to end the year on a good note. This is why we will be doing a 24 hour live stream to raise money for the Children's Cancer Caring Center. "The Children’s Cancer Caring Center (CCCC) is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit corporation organized and operated for the purpose of supporting research and a free total care program for children regardless of race, color or ethnic origin afflicted with cancer; to administer and maintain free ancillary programs that alleviate suffering and anguish of these children and their families; and educate individuals and groups to the profound needs of cancer stricken children."We've worked with the CCCC before and the work that they do is truly inspiring. We first donated to the cause a few years ago. Through a contract with Baptist Children's Hospital, the CCCC was able to turn a  $3,000 donation into $12,000 worth of treatment for a family in need of help. "During the past 51 years, no family has ever received a bill, and no child has ever been turned away". The CCCC works with Baptist Hospital to not just treat children with cancer, but care for them.Our goal is to help in whatever way we can. So with Jeremy Lindenfeld as the leader of the live stream get ready for some crazy antics. We got it all, from egg eating to rap battles, from slam poetry to egg eating, from egg eating to Sea Den performances, you're not gonna want to miss a second. We'll have many people at Jeremy's side to keep him awake as the clock runs down. We're going to have two donation structures during the live stream. One that is goal based, so as we reach different goals we'll perform different actions. The other structure is based on independent donations. For example, a $100 donation will get you a personal visit at your home from Jeremy himself during the live stream.We hope you join us for what's bound to be a weird, yet charitable 24 hours.per donation (just mention in your donation what you choose. )$5- lets you pick one ingredient during cooking time with Lucas (Lucas will eat any FOOD product)$5- Alain will juggle any object of your choice$5- we'll give Stef a wedgie$7.5- we'll give Stef an atomic wedgie $10- roast or compliment (you decide)$10- we slap Jeremy$10- Jeremy throws a deck of cards at Stefan (he does it fast)$15- Jeremy slaps one of us (you decide)$15- Alain twerks for a minute straight$15- Max will slam poetry, he starts with your word (he doesn't understand what slam poetry is)$20- song about you (by Sea Den)$20- Jeremy's grandpa will tell you a tall tale. He's very old$25- make Jer chug a bottle of water (you can do this as many times as you want until Jer throws up) (if he yaks you have to donate another $25)$30- Jeremy shotguns a Monster/Redbull late at night$50- you can choose one of us to get pegged by eggs$51- Jeremy walks through cocowalk in just underwear $55- Walk through cocowalk in just underwear (you choose victim)$75- Jeremy shaves one leg$85- Alain shaves one leg$100- Jump into fountain at Cocowalk and splash around$100- we well drive to your house and take the live stream to you$1,000- We'll do the Great American Challenge (you have to join us)Random Suggestions- we'll decide the pricegoals-every $1,000 Jeremy eats an egg-open to suggestions

name: Em: Terminal Cancer Living Expenses
text: This cancer journey has been a long road with a lot to handle. It's been eight years since my original colon cancer diagnosis; two years ago I was diagnosed as terminal. Cancer does not discriminate and while I have gone through many chemo and radiation treatments, along with other alternative treatments, I still continue to fight, but now in a different way: I have been placed on at home hospice care. I will no longer be doing treatments or possible surgeries. Unfortunately, my financial support for living and medical expenses have run out and I find myself once again having to rely on the generosity of others. My hope is that by sharing my journey transparently, you have been blessed in some way. For me, I have been tremendously blessed by the encouragement and support I have experienced by all of you. The added expenses of planning for a beautiful Celebration of Life is accutely upon me now; I could definitely use some help with that.It is with a humble heart that I reach out and ask for help, once again. I am thrilled with my ability and strength to fight, but the financial strain this has placed on me and my Three Little Birds is starting to take its toll. As I have progressed with my new Medicaid insurance in Nevada, I have found that the biggest issue with medical expenses are the prescriptions and drugs I must take. I have consistently been paying about $800 out of pocket, which causes my living expenses to take a huge hit. My goal with this GoFundMe is to save up money that I can save and draw from as I need it for living expenses, to plan for future Celebration of Life expenses, and (every once in awhile) be able to travel to see my daughter in Las Vegas as she embarks on her first year at UNLV and their nationally renowned debate team...health permitting.Basically, I need help. I want to spend as much time as I have left not worrying about money to live and to enjoy every second I have in this world.If you can give, I would appreciate it. If you cannot give but can pass this link along, it would be a huge help. As always, please follow my journey on Facebook by friending me at "Emily Fay Reese " and on Twitter at @mlereese . I love using my journey to help others be encouraged and to know that they are not alone.Thank you for caring for others. As I continue, I will keep fighting for health care and to save Medicaid, Social Security, and Medicare. Using my story to help others is a goal of mine while I can still do it, and by supporting me, you are also supporting others out there who cannot fight for themselves.Live Life, Love Life, Impact Others,Emily Fay Reese

name: Help Kirsten Find Cancer Treatment!
text: Five years ago on the eve of my daughter’s first birthday,  my sister Kirsten, was diagnosed with stage III colorectal cancer.  Kirsten endured a major surgery and completed 6 months of chemo, and we thought she was in the clear.  After the agonizing illness and death of our mother, Kirsten’s cancer came back with a vengeance in September of 2015.  The cancer had spread to her lungs and liver and progressed to Stage IV. Kirsten’s colon cancer has become difficult to treat because of the specific mutations her cancer has adapted after 2.5 years of therapy. Standard of care treatment options are no longer effective. Kirsten is just 39: she and her husband John  have two teenage children who still need their mother. We are running out of optionsOver the past 2 years, Kirsten has spent hours upon hours trying to find clinical trials. At every turn, she’s run into heart-breaking roadblocks and has spent thousands of dollars traveling to top cancer centers in search of a clinical trial to save her life, only to be told that she doesn’t qualify.  Furthermore, the chemo treatments she is now battling through are not shrinking her tumors and she cannot do them forever due to cumulative toxic side effects. The amount of time, energy money and effort effort to sift through all the research, the treatment options (while going through brutal chemo treatments!)  and then even getting in contact with the people from the various clinical trials is nothing short of a herculean task. Until you go through cancer treatment to the point of considering clinical trials, you would think that a patient’s oncologist would have all the information and knowledge about these various clinical trials. They don’t and they cant. It’s almost impossible for one person to be up to speed on all of this. We’ve tried doing this on our own, and we now know that we need help.Kirsten recently connected with a start-up company, called Driver . Driver’s pioneering service will match her with treatment options at the most innovative cancer centers in the United States. They will evaluate her for treatments at each of these cancer centers and Driver’s team of experts will give her high-touch, personalized support along the way.  The largest barriers that Kirsten has faced while pursuing trial treatments on her own - evaluating the trial, getting in contact with them, seeing if she qualifies, getting records back and forth, setting appointments and evaluating the information - are all things that Driver’s team will help her with. We are launching this Go Fund me campaign to help cover the cost of the service from Driver.Please donate and share!Kirsten has been reluctant to ask for help until she absolutely needed it.  She is Butte-tough to the bone, but today, she needs your help! Please donate to this campaign, share it with everyone you know over social media, email, text message and phone calls.  Cancer is a tough SOB, but we are tougher.  I know, with the help of Driver, that we will find my sister a cure. My family and I are so grateful for your love and support and appreciate any contribution that you can make.About this CampaignThe funds from this GoFundMe campaign will go directly to Driver to pay for their service. Thank you so much for your support!

name: Help Lisa Basler Fight Cancer
text: Let's rally around Lisa Basler, who needs our support through her journey with Stage IV Angiosarcoma Cancer and unexpected medical expenses. On January 14, 2011 Lisa was diagnosed with Stage IV Angiosarcoma of the scalp, which has spread to the abdomen, the lungs, intestines and brain. She has endured many painful rounds of chemotherapy and has underwent many surgeries which have included a complete hysterectomy, a double mastectomy, numerous spinal taps, bone marrow aspirations and removal of her right kidney. Lisa's cancer is unusual and unexpected, a very rare and aggressive form that many doctors have not seen.
