She's in much need of funds to cover the surgery tha involves the removal of cancer tissue and reconstruction of the tongue which is expensive. The recovery requires her to be, at least, one month in intensive care. As well, since this type of cancer is one of the most agressive, the post-operational treatment consists of radiation and chemotherapy. It is our goal to reach out and gather donations to cover all of her expenses. All treatment together ensures a 74-90 % chance of survival and that's why we will gladly accept every single donation. We will be forever  grateful for your help.Gloribelle Ortiz es una joven de 28 años que ha dedicado estos ultimos años a trabajar en el cuidado de infantes y niños en Puerto Rico. Quienes la conocen saben con el amor y la dedicacion que lo hace.  Gloribelle fue diagnosticada hace un mes con cancer en la lengua. En estos momentos se encuentra en categoria 2 y necesita operarse de inmediato. Debido a la condicion, no puede trabajar por lo que necesita urgentemente fondos para cubrir tanto la operacion, como su recuperacion en el hospital y el tratamiento que se le administre luego. La operacion consiste de remover toda el area afectada y reconstruir la lengua. La recuperacion requiere al menos que ella este un mes en cuidado intensivos.  Debido a que este tipo de cancer es uno de los mas agresivos, el tratamiento post-operacion consistira de radiacion y quimioterapia. Nuestra meta es poder recaudar los fondos para cubrir todos sus gastos y que ella pueda continuar su batalla y ganarla. Con el tratamiento y la operacion tiene de un 74-90 % de posibilidad de vencer la enfermedad. Cualquier donacion que pueda hacer sera de gran ayuda.  Estaremos eternamente agradecidos con la ayuda que nos puedan brindar.

name: Be The 1% Cancer Fight
text: Hi Everyone, Welcome to Team Amy!!! Thank you SO much for taking a few minutes to read our mission, and view our videos. We appreciate it very much. On November 3rd, 2015, our world was rocked to its core. Amy Vogt, a 54 year old Mother, Grandmother, Daughter, Sister, Aunt, Cousin, and Friend, was diagnosed with Stage IV Leiomyosarcoma. Amy was told by a team of Oncologists, that she had only 6-8 weeks to live. Sarcomas are a rare, and aggressive, form of cancer. The 5 year survival rate for Stage IV Leiomyosarcoma is “Unavailable/nonexistent” according to the American Cancer Society. With a 0% chance of being alive in 5 years, and a team of oncologists suggesting that treatment should not be pursued because “chemo would make her last few weeks unbearable”. We threw caution to the wind, and decided that Amy will Be The 1%!!!!!! Amy WILL be a statistic that MATTERS!!! We sought out a second opinion, and with the positive outlook that our secondary oncologist had, Amy has endured 8 different chemotherapies over the last 3 years, with one of those being a clinical trial. Through all of these treatments, Amy has continued to work, spend time with her family, and without a break in chemo over the last 3 years, the tumors continued to mutate and grow. On January 17th, 2019, we were given a very grim outlook. The options that we could choose between were 1) “Admit yourself into the Hospital, for a minimum of a week, and a mustard gas derivative will be administered into your port, everyday, for 5 days in a row. IF you survive the week, you can go home for a week, and then return the following week to repeat the treatment.” Well, that sounds terrible, what is the other option? 2) “Hospice”. Amy is 57 years old, her parents are alive, her siblings are alive, she has children and grandchildren that love her unconditionally, Amy said “These are not options, these are death sentences.”Now that you have had a moment to digest the whirlwind of events that have occurred over last three years, we found Envita!!!!! (Their link is included in the videos). Envita can not only help Amy, but they can FIX AMY!!!!!!! Envita, is an Integrated Cancer Treatment Facility, located in Scottsdale, AZ. Envita was created by Oncologists, to offer hope to patients, when standard treatment therapies have failed them. Amy has already completed the preliminary tests while at Envita last week. Treatment is tentatively scheduled to start on February 18th. And now for the tough part, Envita is a stand alone facility, and insurance doesn’t cover one single penny. Everything must be paid out of pocket. It is very difficult for us to ask for help. That is not the type of people we are, however, when your back is up against a wall, and you need to decide between Try or Die, you Try!! From all of us at Team Amy, we Thank You for taking the time to read our story. Also, we invite you to send words of encouragement to Amy as she embarks on a journey that we hope and pray has a positive outcome. Lastly, if you find it feasible, we are so very humbled to receive your donation. Here is the link that explains how amazing Envita is!  https://youtu.be/8IW2AehYAuQ

name: Funeral Expenses for Nissa Weeks Fund
text: My 48 year old cousin Nissa Weeks began this journey in May 2018 with unexplained itching to a diagnosis of Stage 4 Ampullary Cancer (aggressive) on June 18th. Following her surgery, where they found the tumor to be inoperable, she has had so many rare complications, and has been in and out of the hospital for one procedure after another. Nissa is a fighter and continues on this hard and tough journey, but due to her cancer (stage 4), complications, tests, chemo, meds and inability to drive, she is unable to work and her daily/monthly bills/medical treatment fees are becoming too much for her to handle. I kindly ask all of you to please make a small donation (even 1$ or 5$ helps), and please share this link so we can help Nissa with her living expenses and medical costs. Please pray for my dear sweet cousin (a single mom with 18 year old son) as this is a battle like no other! Bless you all and thanks in advance for any contribution you can make.    Let's help fight this cancer battle with Nissa! ❤ #SUPPORT4NISSA

name: Cancer treatment and home health aides
text: Hi, I'm starting this gofundme to try and help my mom cover home health nurses and medical expenses.. Some of you may know her as Reese. But her name is Arica. Her journey has been a long , troublesome and painful one to say the least. On the second week of  November my mom went to the Er with horrible back pain. After many tests it was revealed my mother had cancer. She has been diagnosed with  stage 4 metastatic non small cell lung cancer. It is currently in her lungs, spine, hips, pelvis and ribs. Her Journey--After they found the cancer she was then hospitalized and they began trying to figure out what they should do and where it all was at. They would come to find out she had 2 tumors in her lungs and several on her spine. . A surgery was later done to remove a 3mm lesion and reconstruct her spine. More tests would be done and after a short while they would find out it was also in her hips and pelvis . So they began radiation.  10 treatments to be exact. She was still in pain and was now having difficulty moving her leg with out extreme pain. And could not walk with out a Walker.   On January 9th I drove from ohio to Illinois to be with my mom for 5 days. In those 5 days I watched her agonizing in pain and stressing about Bill's and such.  I ended up finding her a wheelie walker(not sure what it's really called lol) from a nice lady on FB. It helped her tremendously but she needed a wheelchair. Her friend got her one the day after i came back to Ohio♡♡ . Before I left a new sudden pain had arrived she got scheduled to get it checked and they found the cancer has now also spread to her ribs. She has been in and out of the hospital from testing to hospitalizations since then from the intensity of the pain and treatments. She had her first chemo treatment on January 22♡♡♡♡♡On friday January 25th I got a call she went in for pain in her stomach by ambulance.  That turned out to be a blockage in her colon. Her breathing was shallow and o2 was low so they ran tests and found she had 2 blood clots in her lungs and fluid on her lungs as well. So she was admitted again. She was released on 27th to go home but that was short because of instense pain she was readmitted. I made the journey once again on Feb 1st to my mom. She is still currently in the hospital. They have found out thr cancer is through out her pelvis and hip. So she's having radiation treatments again. They are now telling us my mom can not walk on her leg at all its non weight bearing and she has to have someone at home with her at all times. They are placing her in a skilled care facility this week to help her get back and forth from thr hospital for her radiation which is breaking her heart . She doesn't want to be in a facility. We have looked into home health options however it is not covered under my mother's insurance and sadly not affordable . Its roughly 20 a hour at 8 hours a day 5 to 7 days a week depending when my step father works. My mother does have insurance however since she is no longer working all of these finances are falling to my step father . Between the deductables and co pay and monthly fee to keep her insurance she needs help and now for the home health. My step father Lee Noble does work how ever the Bill's are stacking quickly and was so unexpected that they need help covering my mothers cancer treatment Bill's and a home health nurse.  I've offered my mother to come home with me as did my uncle for her to come home with him so she wouldn't need nurses but she keeps saying she doesn't want to leave her home .  . My mother has a very long hard journey ahead of her fighting this cancer. I ask that you donate even just $5 and if you can't donate please share so we can raise the money you help cover her expenses and to have a home health nurse come to her home so she can stay home!!!!

name: Help Colette fight RMS cancer!!
text: As many of you may know, the House family recently received life-changing news. Sweet Colette was diagnosed with a rare form of cancer called RMS. While this is a very serious diagnosis, the good news is the cancer cells are embryonic and the CT scan shows it hasn’t spread. Treatment is starting immediately and is anticipated to take six to twelve months. To comply with the safety protocols of treatment, Collette is being taken out of school, and Kristen and Seth will each be taking turns being home with her and relying on family to fill in to care give as well. The road to healing will be long and taxing on Colette, Benjamin, Kristen and Seth. If we could rally around them and provide any extra support for healing and some normalcy in an especially stressful and scary time, that would mean so much. The goal is to provide donations to help offset missed paychecks and pay medical bills. In Kristen’s words “I can't believe this is happening. I can't believe I've said "Colette has cancer" out loud. I'm supposed to read a similar story online, donate to a go fund me, keep the family in my prayers, and hug my kids tighter when I tucked them in that night. However, this is our new reality…please start praying for this little fire cracker girl. She is an amazing girl and is going to do amazing things in life. There is a bump in her road right now. Thank you so much to family and friends who already know. Your support has been everything. Those aren't hollow words- they have been everything we've needed to survive the past weeks.” Thank you on behalf of the House family for any donations you are able to make. And if you are unable to donate, thank you for your thoughts and prayers. ￼

name: Help Tammi Battle Breast Cancer
text: The last thing you should have to do when you find out you have breast cancer... is wonder how you're going to pay to fight it. But that is the situation our friend Tammi Laster now finds herself in. Tammi was recently diagnosed with breast cancer and now has a year of treatment stretching out before her.  Her first chemo treatment is this week. She's scared... but ready to tackle this. After years of raising 10's of thousands of dollars for charities as a member of the Pearl Jam community, Tammi is now in a position where she needs our help. Having just finished grad school a few months ago and only having part-time work for the last few years, she is facing an incredible financial challenge. So, if you are able to pitch in and help her take this on, please donate here. Truly... any amount will help. We are confident that with the help of her friends and family.... she will rise above.It’s a fragile thing, this life we lead...

name: Join Emily's Army & Battle Brain Cancer
text: Friday 1st February was a huge day for Emily.  This fun-loving, spunky 4 year old was diagnosed with a brain tumour. Not just any brain tumour, a rare and aggressive cancer called ATRT (Atypical Teratoid/Rhabdoid Tumour). Survival rates for this cancer are not high.  She is in for a fight....Emily is the youngest member of an amazing family of 5, who all love life and bring joy to those around them. Deb & Jono are wonderful parents who are generous, loving and faithful. They are always first to lend a hand. Emily's battle has started....she has already undergone surgery to remove the brain tumour and now will be given intensive chemotherapy treatment weekly, radiotherapy and treatment directly into the brain. Emily’s home for the next year will be hospital.So their world has been turned upside down....With Emily in Westmead Hospital and home being in the Southern Highlands, there is a great distance between home and hospital.  With Emily's needs and maintaining life for Emily's older brother and sister, the pressure on Deb and Jono's time and energy will be immense.Deb & Jono believe in a God of love and miracles, so please pray for Emily.  We are all holding firm to God's promises as stated in Psalm 91:16..."With long life I will satisfy her and show her my salvation."Firstly, and foremost, we want people to support this family by joining Emily's Army of Prayer Warriors and ask for God's miracles.Secondly, we know this will be a long road for Emily and her family and we want them to all focus on each other and Emily's treatment, and not be worried about the financial burden that this will undoubtedly create. The ongoing medical expenses for Emily and the constant travel costs between home and hospital will have a financial impact on this family. Also, as you know, these types of illnesses come with unexpected costs, both immediate and in the future, so your support through this Go Fund Me page is a tangible way to care for the whole Hunt family.We ask if you can help meet their financial needs in this difficult time, then please donate to the “Emily's Army” fund and also please share with your close friends and family.Thank you.

name: Sam V.S. Cancer - We Battle Together!
text: Inevitably it seems cancer affects us all at one point in our lives. We may have family or friends who have been diagnosed with it, or have even personally battled this disease. The evil indifference of cancer means it does not care if you’ve been a good person. It does not care if you are a father, a mother or a child. It does not allow you to dictate when it strikes or how aggressive it will be. Cancer is utterly callous towards life itself. The reasons why some people are forced in to this battle they never chose is oftentimes unexplainable. In our own attempts to understand why this is happening to another we imagine ourselves in their place. We know that any day could be our day and the cruelty of cancer could force us in to this same battle. In a certain way our shared vulnerability to cancer unites us. Cancer is our common enemy and we battle it together. For those who know Sam Storkson it is difficult to think of a time he hasn’t been smiling. His positivity and friendliness are immediately apparent even if you’ve only met him once for a short time. If you’ve seen him with his 3 children, Sonny, Scout and Selah, you’re amazed at how supportive, loving and fun a father he is. Sam’s children are his world and he is theirs. Sam’s rock and center of his universe is his wife Nikki. Their mutual love, adoration and support for each other is inspiring. In February of 2018 Sam was given the life-changing diagnosis of Aggressive Metastatic Papillary Thyroid Cancer. Sam’s had his first surgery, a bilateral neck dissection and a total thyroidectomy (thyroid removal) March 5th. Radioactive iodine therapy followed in May 2018. Side-effects of radioactive iodine and thyroid surgery left Sam with bilateral vocal cord paralysis and difficulty breathing. He subsequently had 2 more surgeries on his vocal fold to help his breathing, but they were not as successful as hoped. In December 2018 an ultrasound showed a new suspicious lymph node, the biopsy came back as cancer and he was referred back to Mayo. Sam’s doctors placed a tracheostomy tube in his airway to alleviate his breathing on January 22, Sam is currently recovering from that operation. Sam will need another surgery in the future to remove the cancer and additional tests will be performed to make sure the cancer has not spread. Despite all of this, Sam is hoping to return to work as soon as possible. If you have seen Sam lately you have noticed his difficulties to speak. Despite his paralyzed vocal cords and trouble breathing this amazing man still makes sure to say hi and ask how YOU are doing; and there is ALWAYS a smile on his face. Over the past year Sam has had to be out of work multiple times for doctor’s appointments, treatments and surgeries. The financial strain a major illness causes can be overwhelming, in addition to the physical and emotional strains. The stress of finances can take away from what Sam should really be focusing on, himself and his family. Sam will not battle this alone. His wife and children will not battle this alone. We will battle with them. Please donate what you can. Every dollar raised means less time Sam and his family have to worry about bills and more time just being a family. Let’s show the Storkson’s they are not alone in this fight.

name: The REAL Ricky Martin needs your help!
text:
My father-in-law, Rick Martin is one of the best people I know - and everyone who has ever met him would agree.   He has blessed my family and personally inspired me more than I can express.  Words like generous, selfless, hardworking, full of God’s love are the tip of the iceberg when we think about who Dad is, and what he has meant to us through the years.  Hundreds of people have been touched by my father-in-law and his instant and wholehearted willingness to help in almost any situation you can imagine.Recently, the tables have turned and Rick is the one who needs help.    A devoted husband of over 32 years, he was by his wife Yvonne’s side every step of her own battle with malignant brain cancer (Gliobastoma).  The last 7 months she was bedridden and unable to communicate, Dad never left her side and made sure all her needs were attended to.  In late 2017, he said goodbye to her.  As part of this battle, he willingly gave tens of thousands of dollars from their savings and retirement to try and save his beloved wife.  His daughters Stephanie and Becca were devastated at losing their mom at the young age of 53, and Dad became even more of a rock to those around him.

But 4 months after Yvonne passed, Rick himself was diagnosed with an active form of prostate cancer.   A few weeks ago, his situation seemed hopeless.  By the end of 2018 his symptoms worsened and the pain is at times unbearable.  Diagnosis: The cancer is spreading. There is no cure.  The best option is to get on harmful chemicals for the rest of his life to manage the symptoms.  Two previous treatments including high dose radiation barely slowed it down, and continuing down this road would actually allow the cancer to progress to a point where it is completely drug resistant.Then, what we believe was God’s providence presented the chance for an actual cure: a world class program in Florida with the purpose of curing him.  This 9-week program uses specialized imaging scans, laser radiation treatment, and cryogenic surgery to actually kill the cancer at its source...and has a 95% success rate!Feel free to read about the program, doctors, and testimonies here: Dattoli Cancer Center  The exciting part: Dad's 5 grandchildren aged 1-9 who are crazy about their Grandpa get to have him around a lot longer and at full health.  The challenging part: virtually all of this is outside his insurance network and needs to be paid out of pocket.Many people who know Rick's heart, understanding the life and death urgency we face, are already stepping up to assist with aspects of the trip such as transportation, lodging, and food.  But the total cost of this life-altering treatment itself will exceed $25,000.   A good family friend summed it up by saying "nobody should die because the cure is outside their insurance network."  We passionately want to see Dad be able to continue his legacy of touching so many lives without having to struggle because of the the sizable cost (he's already insisting on working remotely whenever able throughout this 9-week process...because, well, that's who Rick is).  And that’s what this GoFundMe campaign is all about. We are asking you to join us in helping this man who has helped so many without ever asking for anything in return.  I can't imagine my life, or those of my wife and kids without him.  The timing on starting this treatment is ASAP.   Please seriously consider searching your heart, asking your God, and taking any action possible.  Whatever you feel led to donate WILL make a difference, and WILL be gratefully appreciated.    Sharing on social media is hugely important too.  Every dollar brings us one step closer to saving the life of our Dad and Grampa we love so much.  If you are in a position to give a sizable donation it is greatly appreciated and will be put towards this immediately.  If you can only give $10 but will share this campaign 5 or 10 or 50 times...it  helps!Thank you for your generosity.

name: Zhyria Fights Childhood Cancer
text:
My 12-year-old daughter, Zhyria Keyaira Currie has been diagnosed with Osteosarcoma Cancer.

Osteosarcoma is a type of bone cancer in children and adolescents. The tumor often originates in the long bones of the body, and while osteosarcoma frequently starts in a particular bone, it can potentially move to other sites in the body, such as the lungs and other bones.

On May 21st 2018, I took Zhyria to see her primary pediatrician for pain in her knee. The pediatrician checked her and sent her for an x-ray. Afterwards she was taken back to school to finish the day. A couple of hours later the pediatrician called me back to her office to go over the x-ray results. She told me that, “It looks like cancer”, and Zhyria needed to go see the specialist in Atlanta. After the school day had ended, I took Zhyria back to the doctor’s office to hear the results of her x-ray. I wish I could describe in words how I felt, the moment that I heard the results or even the moment that I witness Zhyria get the news, but I can’t. All that I  can say is it was not a good feeling.

￼
￼￼
Zhyria missed the last week of school, and was off to start what is now her fight against childhood cancer.  On May 22nd 2018, she was admitted to the Children’s Hospital Of Atlanta -Scottish Rite,  where she received her first MRI. On Friday May 25th 2018, she had a biopsy and the doctor told me she had osteosarcoma. On May 31st 2018, she had a CT scan and PET scan. On June 1st 2018, her oncologist told me that the cancer had spread to her lungs, and near her spine. On June 8th 2018 she started her first chemo treatment. On Saturday June 23rd 2018, she noticed that her hair was starting to come out. Now she’s facing possible amputation of her right leg because the tumors have gotten bigger.

￼
At a time that should be carefree, when she should be focused on starting 7th grade, bff’s, and etc. She must now learn to accept hospitals, nurses and doctors as her new reality.  Zhyria turned 12 years old on July 19th 2018. I never thought we'd celebrate her 12th birthday in the hospital but God is still good. I thank Him for the 12 years that He has blessed me with her. We had another celebration several days later at her favorite Mexican restaurant.

￼￼
We live about 4 hours away from the Children’s Hospital of Atlanta. We will continue to commute back and forth for treatment.  In an attempt to keep some sense of normalcy, we have decided not to relocate to Atlanta. Zhyria loves her school and being with her friends. She loves attending church, volunteering, family time, making jokes and playing pranks, eating/ trying new foods, and dogs. She’s one of the sweets little girls you’ll ever meet, she has a compassionate heart. She wants to be a mental health counselor when she grows up.  She’s very resilient and has a strong-will, even when she is tired she continues to fight. 

￼
￼
I am a single mother, sole provider for Zhryia and her 15 year old sister Za’Miriya. When we found out that Zhyria was sick, I had to take leave from work to care for her. I have used all of my paid leave time and am currently on leave without pay. We are fortunate to have support from family, friends, co-workers, church members, etc. Needless to say we have only just begun this journey on Zhyria’s fight again cancer. We need your support! We are thankful for all of the positive thoughts and encouragement, well wishes, phone calls, visits, etc. We are asking for any amount of donation that you can contribute. Also and even more important, we ask for your prayers.

Thank You, I appreciate you more than I will ever be able to explain.

name: Kathleen's Breast Cancer Battle
text: If you know Kathleen (Kathy), then you know that not only is she one of the kindest, funniest, and most caring people who we know and love, but she is possibly the strongest Mom, Spouse, Daughter, Sister and Friend that anyone could ever possibly be blessed to have in their lives. You would also know that she has been battling Stage 4 Breast Cancer for a very long time. And in Kathleen style, she has battled it with her usual strength, grace, and humor, all the while enduring multiple types of chemo, procedures, chest tubes, diagnostic studies, surgeries, and a multitude of doctor visits and hospitalizations.  She currently remains hospitalized following yet one more complication, which resulted in the amputation of one of her legs.  She has endured so much pain along the way, and yet in the worst of moments Kathy has continued to be the positive light for everyone around her. Kathleen is now moving into that final, and most difficult, round of her battle.  She will be transitioning from hospital to home this week on Hospice, and her end of life care will begin. As her family prepares to see her through this incredibly difficult and emotional time, we would like to ask for your help.  Because of Kathy’s diagnosis and treatment she was forced to stop working months ago, and so on one income, she and Tim have been facing mounting medical bills on a daily basis. To help ease the financial burden, we have set up this GoFundMe site to accept donations to help them with daily living expenses as well as current and future medical bills, all while her family navigates this final and difficult journey to ultimate peace for Kathy. We are asking for your support, thoughts and prayers, and if possible a financial donation.  Whatever you feel comfortable giving WILL make a difference, and WILL be gratefully appreciated.  Please donate what you can. And in advance, many, many thanks to everyone for your generosity, your prayers, and support.

name: Soutien  à Sabrina - Cancer du sein
text: Le 30 janvier 2019 aura été une journée difficile pour Sabrina. On lui annonce un cancer du sein, triple négatif.Un jeune femme de 27 ans qui a le cancer et bien.... ça frappe.Pour faire une petit résumé , Sabrina a appris qu'elle devait faire un traitement de chimiothérapie pendant 5 mois pour ensuite avoir recours à une mastectomie partielle, même voir complète.Pour elle, les cheveux sont très important afin de garder une estime de soi, être bien et continuer à se sentir féminine dans ce long combat . Malheureusement la prothèse capillaire n'est pas couverte et est très dispendieuse.. Étant seule, sans famille proche pouvant l'aider, nous aimerions lui offrir la possibilité d'avoir un certain montant pour lui permettre d'acheter une prothèse capillaire de qualité.Le combat de Sabrina durera 1 an et ce sans salaire complet, c'est pourquoi j'espère amasser des fonds pour l'aider a subvenir à ses besoins lorsqu'elle sera en arrêt de travail.Chaque don fera une grande différence et apaisera son anxiété face à cette épreuve._____________________________________________________________________January 30, 2019 was a difficult day for Sabrina. She've been diagnosed with triple negative breast cancer.A young 27-year-old woman with cancer, well .... it's hitting. To make a quick summary, Sabrina learned that she had to go through chemotherapy for 5 months, then use a partial mastectomy, maybe complete.For her, hair are important in order to keep a self-esteem, feel good and feminine in this long fight. Being alone, without close family can help her, we would like to offer  the opportunity to have a certain amount to allow her to buy a quality hair prosthesis.Sabrina's fight will last 1 year, without full salary. So your donations will be so beneficial for her when she'll be in medical leave.

name: Help Aven Beat Cancer
text: This January, my little niece Aven Martin, age 6, was rushed to the hospital because of painful headaches, vomiting and other concerning symptoms.  CT and MRI scans revealed that she had a tumour in her cerebellum. On Tuesday, January 15th, the neurosurgeons at the Stollery Children’s Hospital removed 100% of the tumour.  But on Thursday February 7th, after the biopsy and pathology report came back, we found out she has been diagnosed with Medulloblastoma sub-group 3, a highly aggressive and malignant form of childhood brain cancer. Because of her age and cancer type, her doctors are saying that her best possible chance for a cure is to undergo 6-9 weeks of an advanced form of radiation therapy at the University of Florida's Proton Therapy Institute, before continuing with chemotherapy at home in Canada. This therapy will target the cancer cells directly while causing the least amount of damage to her developing brain and young body.The family will likely be able to secure funding for the treatment itself, as well as for Aven and one companion to fly over. Her mother Jacqueline is planning to travel with her, leaving behind Aven's dad, Aaron, and their four other children: Gigi, Lily (Aven's twin sister), Jimmy, and Ammon, who is not yet 3. All expenses aside from the treatment and flights over will be up to them to provide up front and they are considering all options available to them, including applying to charities to potentially get some costs reimbursed. All this comes after a prolonged period of financial hardship for Aven's family. The social worker assisting Aven's family has recommended that they open an account to help cover incidentals for an entire year of treatment, and this will be an ongoing challenge for them.Anything you could contribute here would help Aven's family manage the cost of any medication and treatments not covered by the insurance or government subsidy, (such as physiotherapy). Funds raised will also be used for such things as transportation, accommodations, and food for Aven and Jaqueline while they are out of the country, and expenses for the family if Aaron has to miss more work.Our sweet Aven has overcome a lot so far and her recovery after brain surgery is considered miraculous. But she still has a long way to go. Throughout it all, she has remained one of the kindest, most generous and loving little girls I know. Please help ease her family's burden as Aven continues to fight for her life. Every little bit will make a difference and will be so greatly appreciated!If you would like to know of other ways you can help, please consider the following:-Organize a bottle drive in your community or participate in the Martin family’s fundraisers (Locally there will be a family dance, a bottle drive, bake sales, etc.)-Reach out to any friends or family that you have in that part of Florida, as they will need a support system while there-Air miles transfers so that Aaron can travel to provide occasional support for Aven and Jacqueline.-Cash donations directly to Aven's bank account (please email for more details at: aven.glory@gmail.com)-Gas and grocery gift cards (mailed to PO Box 1632 Onoway, AB T0E 1V0)-Continued prayer and positive thoughts sent their way.-email aven.glory@gmail.com to find out about even more ways to helpPlease SHARE SHARE SHARE online and with your community networks and work internal bulletins.

name: Help Stephanie and Family Fight Cancer - Round 2
text: We recently found out that Stephanie Isaacs has been diagnosed (again) with Triple Negative Breast Cancer that has metastasized to her liver and bone. If you are familiar with Stephanie's story, you know that she successfully completed grueling treatment (chemo, radiation and oral chemo) for Triple Negative Breast Cancer in April 2018. Round 2 of this story began when Stephanie went in for a routine scan January 30th, 2019, only to find out that her cancer had returned. Needless to say, the news that the cancer is back so quickly and aggressively is devastating to Stephanie, her family and those who love and support her.This Tuesday, February 5th, Stephanie will visit her oncology team for a more in depth look at the cancer cells. At that time, her team will devise a plan for the best way to treat this cancer while keeping Stephanie as comfortable as possible. The Isaacs Family will likely also be traveling to Cancer Specialists across the world, to get second opinions and alternative treatment options. They are willing to do whatever it takes to give Stephanie the best chance at survival. In true Stephanie fashion, she is determined to fight like hell against this cancer. And we know that the village that surrounds her and her family will be there every step of the way. The Isaacs Family has taken on the huge burden of cancer, both financially and emotionally, once before. On the financial side, it is no secret that medical bills are very expensive and draining. While insurance covers some aspects of treatment, it doesn't come close to covering the extensive expenses that will come up. Unfortunately, this fight has reached a critical point, and for the first time, they need the financial support of her tribe. Emotionally, cancer can be just as draining. Money from this campaign could help ease some of that burden, so that Stephanie, Steve and Vince may enjoy quality time together without worrying so much about the financial stress.There are many people who have asked how they can help. Donating to this campaign will provide the financial comfort that is much needed at this time. 100% of all monies raised will be given to the Isaacs family to be used wherever they feel it is most needed.Stephanie, Steve and Vince are overwhelmed by the amount of love and support they have already received in this short amount of time. The road will be long and hard, but her village will continue to be #StephanieStrong in our support and prayers.

name: Lindsay Hutchings Cancer Treatment Fund
text: In November of last year, Lindsay started feeling sick and was told that she had a really bad sinus infection; however, none of medications she was prescribed were having any effect.  Eventually, she was referred to an ear, nose and throat specialist. The specialist found that her sinuses were clear, but wanted her to get a CT scan of her neck and chest due to some severe swelling she had been experiencing.  Lindsay got the CT scan the week before Christmas.  Due to the holidays, it took almost two weeks to get the results.  At the beginning of January, we were notified that the scan of her chest showed a large mass (larger than 4 inches in diameter) in the mediastinal cavity (the area around the lungs, esophagus, heart, etc.).  In January, she had two biopsies and a PET scan that eventually led to her diagnosis of Stage 2 Hodgkin's Lymphoma.  The doctors are confident this is highly treatable, and fully expect her to be cured.Over the next few months, she will be undergoing chemotherapy and possibly raditation treatment.  The funds you donate will help to pay for the medical and travel costs, as well as assisting with everyday expenses since I (Jacob) will not be able to work full-time during her treatment.We fully trust that God has a plan for Lindsay, and that through His power she will be fully healed.  We covet your prayers and praise God for the abundance of love and support that all of our friends, family, and church family have shown us over this trying time in our lives.

name: Alessandro Beats Cancer
text: Hi, my name is Andreina and I am hosting this campaign for my friend's son who was diagnosed with Burkitt Lymphoma in his abdomen. Here's his story. Alessandro Luis Martinez Passanisi is 6 years old and was born in Barcelona, Venezuela. He is in 3rd group of kindergarden and is a very happy, sweet, and extroverted boy. He likes music, dancing, fishing, playing baseball, the beach and spending time with his friends. His dream is to be a professional baseball player and since he was very little, he has been training to achieve his dream. (Watch Video)Alessandro has been diagnosed with a cancerous tumor in the abdomen and his family needs our help to pay for some of his treatments. In Venezuela, where he currently lives, there is a serious humanitarian crisis, and therefore, Venezuelans do not have access to quality medicine, let alone cancer treatments. Alessandro has no insurance coverage and is being treated in Miami, Florida. Our goal is to collect $100,000 to be used towards hospitalization, chemotherapy and medicines.  We hope we can count with your contribution so that Alessandro returns very soon to the baseball field to continue scoring Home Runs!_Quiero contarles la historia de Alessandro, el hijo de mi amiga, quien fue diagnosticado con un Linfoma Burkitt en su abdomen y necesita nuestra ayuda.Alessandro Luis Martinez Passanisi tiene 6 años y nació en Barcelona, Venezuela. Está en 3er Grupo de preescolar y es un niño muy alegre, dulce, pícaro y extrovertido. Le gusta la música, bailar, pescar, jugar beisbol, la playa, compartir con sus amigos. Su sueño es beisbolista profesional y desde muy pequeño se ha estado preparando para lograrlo. Alessandro ha sido diagnosticado con un tumor cancerígeno en el abdomen y su familia necesita nuestra ayuda para poder pagar algunos de sus tratamientos. En Venezuela, donde él vive actualmente, se vive una grave crisis humanitaria, y por ende, los venezolanos no tienen acceso a medicina de calidad y mucho menos tratamientos para pacientes de cáncer. Alessandro está siendo tratado en Miami, Florida. Nuestra meta es recoger $100,000 para pagar parte de los tratamientos que Alessandro necesitará. Esperamos poder contar con tu aporte para que Alessandro vuelva muy pronto al campo de beisbol a seguir bateando Home Runs!

name: Cancer sucks
text: Hello everyone, My name is Moses Dakroub, many of you know me as the owner of TCD  (@thecityofdearborn) instragram @TCD on Facebook.  In the past 6+ years i have used this platform to post many gofundme's to help out people in need. Thanks to our followers (may Allah bless you all).  I have personally got know of a very hard working mother of 2 children currently working 2 jobs. We all know how hard it can be living on minimum wage taking care of 2 kids.  Now she is facing a whole other hardship.  Her dad in Ecuador currently has Lupus that unfortunately led to cancer (lymphoma) A cancer of the lymphatic system. Lupus is a chronic autoimmune disease that can damage any part of the body (skin, joints, and/or organs).  Our goal is to raise $3,500 to help cover the medical expenses necessary to keep her father alive. I wish to keep her name anonymous for privacy towards the family.  I can assure you ALL FUNDS will go helping her dad and cutting her a short break in life. Any donation counts, even $1.  Thank you all for your generous donations.

name: RACHEL’S CANCER STORY
text: My name is Lisa, and I am Rachel’s sister. Both myself and her very dear friend Caitlin, were beside ourselves to find out the news that  would forever change our Rachel’s life. On December 29th Rachel and Dave welcomed a beautiful baby girl. Two weeks later Rachel went to the ER for what was believed to be Gallstones. A CT later revealed something extremely rare to adults called an Intussusception of her bowels. That was secondary to a mass. Rachel later that day underwent a bowel resection, and removal of the mass; her second abdominal surgery in two short weeks. Her first was her C-section.  A day short of a week later, the pathology results showed Rachel has stage three colon cancer. This fundraiser is being put together to alleviate some of the financial burden that will arise within the weeks and months to come.  She has had her chemo port put in, and she will start her fight to be around for her beautiful family shortly. Rachel is an amazing mommy (of two), wife, daughter, sister, aunt and friend. We want her only focus to be on kicking cancers A*S! And if anyone can do it, it’s her. We appreciate all the love & prayers we have gotten and continue to receive. We will keep you posted! Thank you!! Lisa & Caitlin

name: Khalidah's cancer treatment
text: The cancer is back.  After going through a full treatment for breast cancer in 2015, and believing it had been defeated, it has reemerged as a tumor in the neck.  Doctors want to begin more aggressive treatment, including both chemotherapy and radiation, as soon as possible.  Such an intense regiment would leave her unable to work, even remotely.  With copays for oncology visits reaching $50 a month (not including the cost of the actual treatments, tests, and recurring pet scans which are hundreds of dollars a piece), and a treatment plan extending over a 4-5 month period, every bit of assistance helps.

name: Sonia Brit Tavener's cancer treatment appeal
text: This is an open letter appealing to our community to help our beautiful friend Sonia Brit Tavener.Sonia is an artist and designer and the proud owner and founder of bob boutique – a place that has enriched Bendigo with good vibes and tangible support for local creatives for more than 14 years.As many of you will know Sonia was diagnosed with a brain tumour in 2012. After surgery and treatment she has spent almost seven years living with cancer. However, it’s little known the challenges she faces as she endures daily seizures, extreme fatigue and other debilitating complications associated with brain cancer.Despite this Sonia continues to live with fierce positivity and the remarkable support of her loving family, friends and customers. She continues to make, create and support others through her small business.After a period of intense illness and a routine brain scan, Sonia has been given the news that the tumour is now growing again. As such she faces even bigger challenges ahead. She has huge decisions to make about how to continue to fight this disease. She is currently in discussions with her oncologist and is researching cancer treatment trials in Australia and overseas. But first she faces a second, immediate brain surgery to determine the nature of the tumour.Sonia and her partner Brian are overwhelmed by what’s facing them, physically, emotionally and financially. Small business, and in particular, retail, is notoriously tough and they are worried sick about keeping up with mortgage repayments and the general costs of living while needing to take time to be with each other, to endure and possibly fund whatever treatment Sonia decides to pursue, either in Australia or overseas. They are motivated to do anything it takes.As her friends we can’t take away the trauma of treatment. But we can dig deep to show how much we love and support her by contributing to and sharing this Go Fund Me page to help give her the best chance possible.Anyone who has stepped foot inside bob boutique has felt something of Sonia’s spirit. She is a beautiful, kind and loving soul who needs some serious help right now. Please join us.And if you’d like to treat yourself or a loved one, please call into bob boutique and purchase something special. Supporting Sonia’s business will also help a great deal.  www.bob.net.au

name: Help Support Elena's Fight Against Cancer!
text: Please help Elena in her fight against pancreatic cancer.PLEASE READ ON and get to know the story of this amazing, beautiful, strong mother of 5.3 months after Elena’s sister’s passing in 2016 from Pancreatic Cancer,  Elena visited the doctor because of abdominal discomfort and continuous irregular bowel movement.  Little did anyone know that she would receive a crushing diagnosis of a borderline Stage 2 to 3 Pancreatic Cancer.  After extensive consultations with her doctor and due to the nature of Elena’s job, she was forced to quit and focus on her treatment and recovery, while living off of her savings.  But living off savings for 2 and 1/2 years eventually gets exhausted.Elena received chemotherapy and radiation treatments for 2 years, but after numerous attempts of medical intervention in New York, she opted to halt her treatments.  In hopes of a better way of living than a stressful environment of living in New York City, she decided to continue her battle against the cancer in her homeland, the Philippines.  This decision comes at a cost.  Living and receiving treatments in the Philippines takes a toll financially, as medical costs come out of pocket.  Aside from the physical and emotional aspects of having pancreatic cancer, Elena also struggles with the financial burden of combatting this disease. She has exhausted her life savings to pay for her treatments and despite receiving financial support from her children here in the US, it is simply not enough.  Case in point: Her most recent visit to the hospital, including consults, X-rays, and paracentesis procedure cost them close to PHP 83,000 (USD 1,600).  She needs to do this at least twice a month.Cancer never makes for a good story but let us try to give Elena a happy ending. We would appreciate any form of support you can give them - donations, suggestions or recommendations regarding the treatments, or simply spreading Elena’s story will go a long way.Thank you in advance for your time and contributions. We cannot thank you enough nor forget your generosity in this time of need.

name: Cancer Sucks
text: Rest in Peace our friend - 10:59am February 5th, 2019.In September,  2018 our good friend Nate Davis was diagnosed with stage 4 Renal Cell Carcinoma (Kidney Cancer). The cancer had also spread to his lungs. After successfully removing his infected kidney and tumor, Nate quickly faced another hurdle as he developed a C Diff infection shortly after the surgery. He endured surgery to remove the infection and consequently had to have 90% of his colon removed. Still, he continued to be determined to win his fight against cancer. During the past several months he has fought valiantly in hopes of defeating this terrible disease, with his wife, children, family, and friends as his driving motivation. Sadly, Nate passed away Tuesday morning (Feb 5th) surrounded by family and close friends. At the time of his diagnosis, Nate had just embarked on fullfilling a lifelong dream of starting his own business. During this transition he was able to obtain medical insurance, but unfortunately that will not be enough to cover all of the related expenses. At this time we are trying to raise $25,000 that will go directly to his wife Alicia and their family to assist with these many immediate expenses. Anything above this amount will obviously be given to them to cover future expenses which will quickly be coming in. Nate is an amazing individual who has touched many lives. He continually provided service to others and gave everything he could to those less fortunate than himself. Our hope is to try and continue the generosity that we have learned from Nate these many wonderful years of knowing him. His positive outlook on life is infectious, and his influence will last a lifetime.Please read about Nate's inspirational story on his blog listed below. Nate leaves behind his beautiful wife Alicia and their four wonderful children.  https://cancer.askdavis.com Update: at 10:00pm on Feb 5th -  I am sitting here looking at the donations and I am blown away. What a great tribute to Nate. He truly touched many lives. On behalf of Nate's family, let me express a sincere thank you for your assistance in this difficult time. Each dollar will make a significant difference but more importantly is the love and support from the people behind the donation.Update: Funeral services will be held at 2:00 pm on Saturday, February 9, 2019 at Sandy West Stake Center, 8670 South 220 East, Sandy, UT. A visitation will be held Friday evening from 6:00 – 8:00 pm and Saturday from 12:00 – 1:30 pm prior to the services.

name: Mandy's Cancer Fight
text: Mandy (LeMoine) Lehnert was diagnosed with colon cancer in May 2018. After having consulted with her son, Nic Johnson, she has decided to seek treatment at the MD Anderson Clinic in Texas. Her wish, as she fights the good the fight, is to have her husband, Robert, by her side. There have been many requests from family and friends as to how they can support and help Mandy. We have decided to start a Go Fund Me Page to allow those who are able to support her fight financially. As you can imagine there are many costs involved with fighting cancer - Mandy is fortunate to have insurance covering the cost of the treatment, for now. However, the expense of Robert being off work to be with her in Texas will take a toll on them. They will be forever grateful and blessed by whatever their family and friends are able to monetarily help with. Thank you in advance for your love and support!!

name: #FIGHT4KERRY GREEN
text: #FIGHT4KERRYKerry is a vibrant, loving 39 year old mother, wife, sister, aunt, daughter and my best friend that is battling breast cancer for a 4th time!  She has spent the better part of her life as a mom - as a cancer patient.Help me help Kerry get the best possible treatment so she can finally beat this awful disease so she can raise her son and see him become a compassionate and loving young man.HISTORY:Kerry grew up in a small northern town of Sudbury, Ontario where she met the love of her life, bought a house and lived the fairy tale life that every little girl dreams about.  This fairy tale also included having the cutest baby boy Ryley in 2012.  That is where this fairy tale ends because Ryley has had to grow up watching his mom fight cancer since he has been two years old.  The word Cancer is a part of his speech that is normal for him but we all know that it shouldn't be part of anyone's vocabulary - especially at such a young age.  He has witnessed the effects of this horrendous disease all of his entire life and is still living thru the ups and downs of not knowing.  This beautiful family needs a chance to live a life free of worry from this despicable disease!  She was first diagnosed in 2014 at the young age of 35, with stage 1 Triple Negative breast cancer (TNBC). She underwent a lumpectomy, 6 cycles of chemo and 30 rounds of radiation. She did well until May 2016 when she got the bad news once again. So she received 6 more rounds of chemo followed by a bilateral mastectomy in Sept 2016. A PET scan was performed and the results came back negative for cancer, so no further treatments were needed at that point. She thought she had finally battled and beat cancer! Unfortunately in August 2017 she was given the bad news once again after a routine follow up appointment. She went onto 6 more months of chemo, more surgery and another 28 rounds of radiation.  A chest CT was performed and results showed no more signs of cancer.  Kerry beat it for a third time! On July 26, 2018 after a another routine CT chest scan & chest ultrasound she was diagnosed a 4th time. The left side came back positive for Metastatic ductal carcinoma.  TREATMENT:Even with being diagnosed four times, she is still positive and determined more than ever to BEAT this disease that has afflicted her for so long for the sake of loving life and her family more than ever.  GIVING UP IS NOT AN OPTION! Her treatment options at this time are as follows:  1)  her Canadian doctors are getting a second opinion from Toronto specialists to evaluate if surgery is an option at this point and to radiate, but fears it may not be promising given her history and pour results of all previous treatments.  A referral has also been sent to Princess Margaret in Toronto, Ontario to exhaust all possible treatments in Canada. 2)  Kerry has been exploring alternative cancer treatments not currently available in Canada, and has reached out to cancer clinics in Germany. These clinics offer specialized treatments such as regional chemotherapy (RCT). RCT has had good response rates for people in Kerry’s situation. However, pursuing this treatment is costly - approximately $200,000. She has a lot to think about and is considering all of the suggestions from her Canadian doctors, German hospitals and cancer clinics which offer the world's most advanced treatments.  Time is of the essence since it has already been 4 weeks since she has been diagnosed for the 4th time and no treatment plan has been set forth yet.  Regardless of where she decides to follow up with treatments, there are financial strains such as travelling and accommodations that will be incurred.There is HOPE!Several Canadians have explored the alternative cancer treatments and have had positive results.  Kerry has been in contact with a local survivor - a young woman who was diagnosed with breast cancer that had metastasized - that was in much of the same situation as she is currently in . This Canadian girl was told that she only had a few months to live. She decided to take fate into her own hands and went to Germany for RCT.  Her recent PET scan shows that there are no further signs of cancer.  And Sudbury also has a Chelmsford man attending the Germany clinic in September 2018 with positive anticipation of good news.  Please help Kerry finally beat this disease and get back to being a great mother, wife, sister, aunt, daughter and my best friend.  She needs your help to lessen the financial burdens that his awful disease has put on her and her family.   Please donate since time of the essence.Donate today!God bless you for all of your best wishes, prayers and generosity!

name: Kim's fight to beat breast cancer
text: A few weeks ago our family was informed of the unexpected; that our loving mom, sister, and daughter, Kim, was diagnosed with triple negative breast cancer. What this means is that the cancer was not triggered by anything but simply grew on its own. The treatment plan as we know of currently is most likely going to be a series of chemotherapy, a mastectomy, as well as radiation. The doctors currently do not have a direct order of treatment but we do know that it is going to be a long and hard road ahead. The funds from this page will go towards the medical bills because of Kimberly being a single mother to two, and may be looking at anywhere from 4-9 months off work because of surgery and treatment.  Anything and everything is appreciated whether it is a hand to hold or a simple donation. We will know more information about when treatment will start and will keep that updated through our Caringbridge page. Thank you for any help you can give and know our family appreciates all the support! Thank you.

name: Help Danielle, stage 4  cancer mother of 3
text: Danielle is a 35 year old mother of 3 and loving wife of 14 years. She has just been diagnosed with stage 4 colon cancer that has spread to her liver and lymph nodes. Just days after finding tumors,  she was told that surgery is not an option. Her liver is 3 x's the normal size and is filled with masses. She will need treatment to try and shrink the cancer and stop it from growing and spreading throughout her body. These treatments are extremely expensive even with insurance. We're asking first for prayers. Please pray for a miracle. If you can donate, every dollar will go towards covering medical expenses, medication and her vitally needed treatments. I know that there are so many people battling cancer and everyone has a story of how cancer has affected their lives in some way,  but i'm asking you to please,  please,  from the bottom of my heart,  to donate towards this cause. Danielle is the oldest sibling of 6 kids and life long friend to many. We are trying everything we can to save her life. Thank you for your kindness and generosity.

name: Mavrick's Cancer Treatment
text: Hello my name is Nathan Daniels. I am a specialist in the US Army and on October 13 I was blessed with a beautiful baby boy named Mavrick. Things were great and had just started a solid routine in our life when a large mass was found on our sons pelvis which was later diagnosed as rhabdomyosarcoma. Rhabdo is a fast spreading cancer that attaches to soft tissue and can be very deadly. We started our treatment in North Carolina at UNC and later had to be transferred to the Childrens Hospital of Philadelphia where our son received his surgery and is set to receive proton radiation and chemotherapy. The process has taken a huge financial burden  on our family due to the extensive treatment and constant traveling. My wife and I are two very young adults trying to give the best we can to our little Mav and we need your help. Please like share and if you feel the need to donate. Anything helps and thank you ahead of time. God Bless!

name: HELP ZION FIGHT LYMPHOMA CANCER
text: As we all know Cancer does not discriminate. On September 21, 2018, the lives of the Thompson family were forever changed when they took their 13-year-old daughter, Zion, for a routine volleyball physical. After the doctor noticed that Zion's lymph nodes were seriously swollen, he sent her for some blood work, and requested an ultrasound on her neck for the following week. Around 7:15 that night, the doctor called and insisted that the family take Zion to Riverbend Hospital immediately for a CT Scan because her blood work came back with some alarming abnormalities. After waiting three excruciating hours in the ER, Zion finally got a scan at 11 PM. Zion and her family then waited about two more heart-wrenching hours for the results. When the entire family was escorted into a private, dimly lit room with small couches--they immediately knew this sterile room would be forever engrained in their memories. That's when the doctor came in and gave them the blur of the news that their 13-year-old daughter has CANCER! Just in the peak of her teen years when all is suppose to be new and bright, Zion was diagnosed with Hodgkins Lymphoma. And that’s just what Zion is to so many of us; she is a bright light with an infectious smile and a contagious laugh! Although the family is heartbroken and Zion is scared, they know God is with them every step of the way and so are we! As coaches at Willamette Christian School, we had the privilege of watching Zion grow in stature and character. Please help us support Zion and her family in this fight. Moreover, being that Zion's parents are currently facing some financial hardships, your financial support would help Zion and her family cover her mounting medical bills and other expenses related to her care as Zion continues to receive treatments to beat this horrible disease. Zion is ready to fight. Let's fight with her. Please know, that no gift is too great or too small.

name: Fighting Back From Cancer
text: On April 26th, 2018, I was diagnosed with Hodgkin's Disease Lymphoma and staged at a Stage lllB. After going through many tests, I finally began my chemotherapy. However, because of the job I do, which is a Certified Nursing Assistant, my oncologist informed me that I would not be able to work while undergoing chemo because I would not be able to protect myself from getting germs or being sick. Along with this, I am currently still trying to stay enrolled in classes for this coming year because my scholarship has ran out. I am now trying to pay out of pocket in order to finish up my last year, and not being able to work has really taken a toll on that. The funds that I will receive will not only help me attend school, but also help take care of my medical expenses until I am able to continue back at work. After 6 cycles of chemotherapy, the scans showed that the tumor was gone. However, after a month another scan was performed & the tumor was back . I now have to undergo a more intensive chemotherapy which keeps in the hospital 4-5 days . Once I have completed the chemotherapy & am in remission , then I have to undergo a bone marrow transplant & stem cell procedure which leaves me in the hospital 4 weeks , a caregiver 24/7 for 30 days after I am released & have to take it easy for a few months after .Any little bit or lot of support I can receive to help me pay my bills (living & medical) , along with preparing to continue courses next semester  #FightingWithJae

name: Ramesh Punna Cancer Fund and Family Fund
text: IntroductionRamesh Punna is a resident of San Antonio, TX.  He lives there with his wife, Sridevi, and teenage daughter, Amrutha.  Ramesh works for the US Air Force (as a contractor), and Sridevi works for US Veteran Affairs.Since mid 2018, Ramesh has had a series of medical issues.  After several misdiagnoses, on Christmas Eve of 2018, Ramesh has been diagnosed with Lung Cancer stage 4 -- an advanced stage with no cure.  Cancer has spread to Ramesh's lungs, liver and stomach.  Ramesh has numerous symptoms currently such as difficulty breathing, depression, anxiety, physical disability, throat pain, swollen legs, loss of taste and appetite, and urinary issues, among others.TreatmentIn January 2019, Ramesh received Chemotherapy and Immunotherapy at MD Anderson Cancer Hospital in Houston, TX.  Chemotherapy resulted in significant side effects, which made his doctors declare that they cannot administer Chemotherapy anymore.Ramesh's lungs fill up with fluid every few days and disable his lungs breathing functions.  The doctors installed tubes in each of his lungs that exit his skin on his back in order to drain the fluid from the lungs regularly.Campaign FundsRamesh is currently on short-term disability, while his wife, Sridevi, is on unpaid leave for the most part.  Sridevi can only work approximately 2 days a week since she has to provide care to her husband.  The funds raised from this campaign will be used for the medical treatment of Ramesh and for supporting his family.

name: Kelly Jentes — Lifetime Cancer Warrior
text:
We thought we had won the fight.This is our sister, Kelly, in 1979, when she was diagnosed at four years old with a malignant brain tumor. After a six-hour surgery and a round of radiation, followed two years later by another tumor, long surgery and round of chemo … we thought Kelly had beat the odds.She was cancer free for 38 years. On September 25, 2018, Kelly experienced a seizure followed by many more in the ensuing months. What was first thought as a stroke was later confirmed as another brain tumor. For those who do not know Kelly, she may well be the sweetest, kindest and most gentle soul you could ever meet. She is a friend to all furry creatures and loves adventure, traveling, hiking and biking.  Kelly is an extremely compassionate person with a heart of gold — and beloved aunt to her nieces and nephew. Parts of her life have not been easy or fair, but despite her ongoing fight with cancer, she remains optimistic and ready to put on her boxing gloves to show cancer who is boss. The operation to remove her latest brain tumor was on January 22, 2019.  The resulting biopsy confirmed a diagnosis of Glioblastoma Multiforme (GBM) — an incredibly aggressive and fast-growing form of cancer.  Kelly has a long, tough road ahead.  As a result of the surgery, she has lost most movement in her right arm and right leg. She is currently undergoing physical therapy at an in-patient rehabilitation center for the next few weeks to regain her strength and let her brain heal. She will most likely require significant rounds of chemotherapy, radiation, and outpatient physical therapy.  Her recovery is very much a work in progress.We are establishing this fund to help assist Kelly with her out-of-pocket medical and living expenses.  She is currently unable to work and because of her pre-existing condition, insurance has always been — and will continue to be — an uphill battle. 

The uncertainty of it all may be the toughest part — and it makes you realize that all you have is the present moment. If we EVER needed to lean on family and friends, now is the time. We simply ask that you reach as far as you can to spread the word and help us meet our goal (please share this page with your family and friends). Whatever you can contribute will be welcomed and received with deep appreciation.Thank you for your support in helping Kelly.With immense gratitude,Amy & Emily (Kelly’s sisters)

name: How You Can Help Izzy Battle Brain Cancer in CNY
text: On January 19, 2019, 9 year old Izzy Vecchio was diagnosed with brain cancer, a medulloblastoma. Izzy underwent a lengthy operation to remove most of the tumor, but has a very long road ahead of her. She will need 6 weeks of radiation treatments (5 times a week) and then will undergo 7-9 rounds of chemotherapy over 14 months - Additional hospital stays are unfortunately inevitable. Matt and Elise have 3 other young children at home, Sophia 11, Carina 6 & Toby 2. In addition to caring for Izzy, Toby has down syndrome.This requires physical, occupational & speech therapy sessions, along with additional doctors appointments.The road ahead is unknown and will be challenging for Izzy and her family. We ask that you help in any way you can. The money raised will help with costs associated with Izzy’s treatments. Please keep Izzy and her family in your prayers. Thank you for your donation!

name: Yvette "Cherry" Perry cancer fight
text: Yvette "Cherry" Perry is my wife and mother to my 3 kids, our youngest is 8. She was diagnosed with stage IV colorectal cancer in Feb. The cancer has spread to her liver and peritoneum. She is undergoing chemo now. The plan is to shrink the tumors enough to hopefully try other therapies. I am the singer in Cherry Poppin Daddies. My wife Yvette is the beautiful woman in the video. She stars in a number of our videos. Now that she has been stricken, I am currently unable to work (playing music), as my new job is to be her healthcare advocate, her primary care provider and Dad/household manager for her and our littlest one.We plan to use any funds we raise to: take care of household costs, pay for treatment, and also toward getting her in the vicinity of a clinical trial down the line that might save her life.  I realize that this is the beginning of a marathon. Bills are coming our way already. My wife and I are proud, self sufficient people and it makes me sick to be typing anything like this, but this is where fate has put us.In the past few days, I have received so much in the way of prayers, hopeful stories and good wishes. Community has found us. This is the greatest thing, a heart melting gift that we continue to get by the moment. Myself, I am already forever altered inside regarding the inherent goodness of people. This is a transformative event that inspires me to strive to be the best version of myself I can. I vow to pay these kindnesses forward when I am able in the future.The arts have always been the rock for both my wife and myself. Its been a tough, but rewarding life. Through the arts, we have been blessed to find you, our support system of warm-hearted, kindred spirits. Truth, beauty and gestures of human kindness live forever.Thanks,Steve

name: Gather Against Cancer
text: Oi Pessoal, esse é meu amigo Edmar "Sorriso". Ele se mudou para os EUA há 3 anos atrás para viver o sonho americano e, infelizmente, foi diagnosticado há uma semana com o câncer de colo de estágio 4 que se espalhou para o fígado e pulmões.Acreditamos na vida e queremos que ele viva muitos mais anos. A missão dele neste lar ainda não foi concluída.Qualquer coisa ajuda, já que ele não poderá trabalhar durante a quimioterapia e outros tratamentos. Quem puder compartilhar também fará um grande favor já. Oremos ”___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________My name is Edmar. I moved to the US 3 years ago to pursue the america dream and, unfortunately, I was diagnosed a week ago with Stage 4 Colon Cancer that has spread to my liver and lungs. I believe in life and I want to live for many more years to come, my mission on this earth has not been completed yet. Anything helps since I won't be able to work during chemotherapy and other treatments.Your help will be going to help me with housing and expenses, food, alternative treatments and personal care. Since right now I won’t  be able to work due to pain caused from the illness. My first chemotherapy will start on February 11th.   Please help with anything you can. But, above all, keep me on your prayers. EdmarDallas-TX.

name: Cancer Sucks - Please Help Nick!
text:
UPDATE: Nick's surgery went well and he's on his second day in recovery. We will provide more information as it's available. Nick and his family sincerely appreciate all the kindness, love and prayers. THANK YOU SO MUCH! ❤❤❤

 -------------- 

UPDATE:  Nick met with the oncologists at Anschutz Medical Campus - University of Colorado Cancer Center in Aurora.  Good news is that the cancer has not spread to any other parts of his body.  Bad news is it has been rapidly growing and is now the size of a golf ball located near his parotid salivary gland. He will undergo surgery this Thursday, Jan 17th for an estimated six-hours.  From there, they will do genomic testing on the removed tumor to determine what type of therapy will be needed to fight this aggressive cancer. We ask that you please keep Nick and his family in your thoughts and prayers.  On behalf of the Hancock family, I would like to express the extreme gratitude they feel for the generous monetary gifts everyone has provided.  The funds raised have already proved to be very helpful.  We are all so grateful for the generosity of friends, family and strangers.  Thank you so much! Billie =========================== Hello!  Being diagnosed with a serious illness like cancer is devastating, not only for the individual, but family, friends and loved ones feel the pain.  Like any life changing illness, cancer affects everything in your life and adding an overwhelming financial burden to an already stressed situation makes things even worse.  Bottom-line, it is truly sad how something as material as money can stop someone from getting the life-saving help they so desperately need.  Unfortunately, this is the situation Nick’s family is currently facing.  Days before Christmas, Nick was diagnosed with a rare high grade sarcoma cancer.  At this point, details of exactly what is happening to his body are uncertain; however, we do know that a trip to MD Anderson in Houston, Texas is urgent followed by necessary surgery and cancer treatments.    As many of you know, the Hancocks are very close and like with everything, they are tackling this battle together.  They are willing to sacrifice whatever it takes including financial hardship to save their son’s life.  After much research, Nick’s mom, Gina found MD Anderson to be one of the best clinics in the country to treat this rare cancer and knows this may be the only way to help their son.  Surgeons at MD Anderson are amongst the most skilled in the world, using the latest techniques to conquer this rare cancer.  Like all surgeries, sarcoma surgery is most successful when performed by a specialist with a great deal of experience in this particular procedure.  As a family friend, I am asking for a little help… I know there are millions of people in the world currently dealing with cancer and other serious illnesses so I hate to even ask, but it would be very helpful and much appreciated if you can find just a little extra to donate to Nick’s family. Anything helps including prayers.  Thanks in advance! As we are notified of Nick’s status, updates will be posted for all to view.    Thanks again.

name: Help Alana's Fight Against Cancer
text: After numerous appointments over the last few months, Alana was diagnosed with Non Hodgkin's Lymphoma. She will have to undergo treatments over the next 6 months at MD Anderson in Houston TX. Many friends and family have reached out to inquire how they can assist.  Despite Alana's reluctance,  we have decided to start a Go Fund Me page to assist with travel and lodging expenses.  We also solicit your prayers, as we know, God is a healer!

name: José René Finol (René) Cancer battle
text: [English]Dear family and friends,On August, 2018, we received news that our beloved René was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer.  What ensued has been a big battle to try to save his life.René has a beautiful family. He lives in Venezuela with his wife and 4 children. René has been a cattleman all of his life. It's hard to imagine René wearing something different than his cowboy gear, his handsome hat and his boots.  His family owned land in his home country, and he had a special connection with nature since a very young age. Over the last 20 years, Venezuela  has gone through one of the greatest crisis in its history which has slowly worsened with time.  Private lands have been invaded with the approval of a corrupt government, property prices have plummeted due to currency's devaluation product of its volatility, prices of food and other goods have risen exponentially with hyperinflation levels in the hundred-thousand %.  Hospitals have not escaped this crisis either. These things, and many other unfortunate situations, have driven millions of people to leave the country.  Despite all this, René stayed in his home country all these years, tending his land, staying connected with what he loves the most after his family, his animals and nature.In the last few years, René discovered a new passion, conservationism.  He found many species of birds and different animals that inhabited the lands he walked on, and dreamed of creating a sanctuary for all of these beautiful animals to live in without fear of being killed.  He would get the most amazing pictures from his trips into these beautiful lands.  One of them, a python wrapped around a deer as it was trying to swallow it, was published in a monthly publication in the US.  Like this picture, I remember seeing the picture of a bright red bird perched on a fence wire in these tropical lands.  Just beautiful.When we heard the news of René's illness we knew it was going to be a hard battle, but he has been blessed with the love of his family and good friends who are helping him during this phase in his life.  In an effort to seek treatments that would heal him, René came to the US in early 2019. René is currently at the Baptist Hospital in Miami, Florida, and has been offered a treatment that could treat his disease.  This treatment has already started as time is of the essence. Payment will be provided as soon as we can complete the funds. The cost is just under $70,000, aside from all diagnostics exams, etc.  He recently got done with his first round of chemotherapy.  He was scared, but seemed to  come out of it with very little side effects. An answer to prayer.  These treatments are costly and our prayer is that we're able to complete the funds necessary to pay for them soon. We're reaching out to the world to ask for help to cover these expenses.  If you feel led to contribute, we will be forever grateful.  If all you can do is pray for René, that is also a huge gift. We need all the prayer we can get.  Pray for peace and strength for René as he goes through this process, for his family to remain strong, and for wisdom for the medical personnel treating him.  Thank you for your consideration and for reading René's story.The Finol family.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[Español]Queridos familiares y amigos,En Agosto de 2018 recibimos la noticia de que nuestro querido René había sido diagnosticado con cáncer pancreático.  En ese momento comenzó la batalla para tratar de salvar su vida.René tiene una hermosa familia. Él vive en Venezuela con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. René ha sido ganadero toda su vida. Es difícil visualizar a René con otra indumentaria que no sea la de un vaquero, su elegantesombrero y sus botas. Su familia tenía tierras en su país natal y él tuvo siempre una conexión especial con la naturaleza desde una edad temprana. Durante los últimos 20 años Venezuela ha atravesado por una de las peores crisis en su historia, la cual ha emperorado con el tiempo. Tierras privadas han sido invadidas con la aprobación de un gobierno corrupto, los precios de las propiedades se han derrumbado debido a la devaluación de la moneda producto de su volatilidad, los precios de la comida y otros bienes ha aumentado exponencialmente con una hiperinflación de cientos de miles %. Los hospitales no han escapado esta crisis tampoco.  Éstas y otras situaciones desafortunadas han impulsado a millones de personas a irse del país. A pesar de todo esto, René se ha quedado en el país durante todos estos años cuidando sus tierras y manteniéndose conectado con lo que ama más después de su familia, sus animales y la naturaleza.En los últimos años René descubrió una nueva pasión, el conservacionismo. Él encontró muchas especies de pájaros y animales que habitaban en las tierras que él recorría y soñaba con crear un santuario en donde todos estos animales pudieran vivir sin tener temor de que los mataran. Él sacaba las fotos más increíbles en estos viajes que él hacía a estas hermosas tierras.  Una de ellas, una serpiente "Tragavenado" enrollada alrededor de un venado cuando se disponía a tragárselo, apareció en una publicación mensual en los Estados Unidos.  Como ésta, recuerdo también la foto de un pájaro de color rojo vibrante posado sobre un alambre de una cerca en esas tierras tropicales.
